 17588                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17589                                  
 17590                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17591                                  
 17592                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17593                                  ;
 17594                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 17595                                  ;
 17596                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 17597                                  ;							seg ffff )
 17598                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 17599                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 17600                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 17601                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 17602                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 17603                                  ;
 17604                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 17605                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 17606                                  ;
 17607                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17608                                  
 17609                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17610                                  HMAPtr:
 17611 00001727 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 17612                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 17613 0000172C 8B3E[D707]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 17614                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 17615 00001730 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 17616 00001733 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 17617 00001735 803E[DD07]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 17618                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 17619 0000173A 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 17620 0000173C FF1E[D907]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 17621                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 17622 00001740 8B3E[D707]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 17623                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 17624                                  HMAPtr_retn:
 17625 00001744 C3                      		retn
 17626                                  
 17627                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17628                                  
 17629                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17630                                  
 17631                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 17632                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 17633                                  
 17634                                  move_sector:
 17635                                  
 17636                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 17637                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 17638                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 17639                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 17640                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 17641                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 17642                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 17643                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 17644                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 17645                                  ;
 17646                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 17647                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 17648                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 17649                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 17650                                  ; back to a byte move.
 17651                                  
 17652 00001745 FC                      		cld
 17653 00001746 51                      		push	cx
 17654 00001747 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 17655 0000174A 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 17656 0000174E 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 17657 00001750 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 17658 00001754 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 17659 00001756 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 17660 00001758 59                      		pop	cx
 17661 00001759 C3                      		retn
 17662                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17663                                  
 17664                                  movsec_bytes:
 17665 0000175A D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 17666 0000175C F3A4                    		rep movsb
 17667 0000175E 59                      		pop	cx
 17668 0000175F C3                      		retn
 17669                                  
 17670                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17671                                  
 17672                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17673                                  
 17674                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 17675                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 17676                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 17677                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 17678                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 17679                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 17680                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 17681                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 17682                                  ;
 17683                                  ; input conditions:
 17684                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 17685                                  ;
 17686                                  ; output:
 17687                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 17688                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 17689                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 17690                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 17691                                  
 17692                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS 5.0
 17693                                  check_wrap:	
 17694 00001760 50                      		push	ax
 17695 00001761 53                      		push	bx
 17696 00001762 06                      		push	es
 17697 00001763 57                      		push	di
 17698 00001764 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 17699 00001767 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 17700                                  		; 26/12/2023
 17701 00001769 26F6453F01              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 1
 17702                                  		; 12/12/2022
 17703                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 17704                                  		;;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 17705 0000176E 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 17706 00001770 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 17707 00001774 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 17708 00001776 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 17709 00001779 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 17710 0000177B 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 17711 0000177D F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 17712                                  
 17713                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 17714                                  ; last sector on that track.
 17715                                  
 17716 0000177F 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 17717 00001781 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 17718                                  		; 18/12/2022
 17719 00001783 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 17720 00001784 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 17721                                  					; if on	boundary
 17722                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 17723                                  not_on_bound:
 17724 00001786 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 17725 00001789 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 17726 0000178B 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 17727 0000178D 40                      		inc	ax
 17728 0000178E 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 17729 00001790 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 17730                                  		; 02/09/2023
 17731 00001793 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 17732 00001797 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 17733                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 17734                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 17735 00001799 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 17736 0000179B 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 17737 0000179C 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 17738                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 17739 0000179E F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 17740                                  
 17741                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 17742                                  
 17743 000017A0 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 17744 000017A2 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 17745 000017A4 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 17746                                  
 17747                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 17748                                  
 17749 000017A6 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 17750 000017A8 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 17751 000017AA 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 17752                                  no_head_bound:				
 17753 000017AB 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 17754 000017AD 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 17755 000017AE FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 17756 000017B0 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 17757 000017B2 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 17758 000017B4 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 17759 000017B7 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 17760 000017B9 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 17761 000017BB D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 17762 000017BD 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 17763 000017BF 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 17764 000017C1 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 17765 000017C3 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 17766 000017C5 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 17767                                  no_wrap:				
 17768 000017C7 F8                      		clc
 17769 000017C8 5F                      		pop	di
 17770 000017C9 07                      		pop	es
 17771 000017CA 5B                      		pop	bx
 17772 000017CB 58                      		pop	ax
 17773 000017CC C3                      		retn
 17774                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17775                                  
 17776                                  no_wrap_head:				
 17777 000017CD 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 17778 000017CF FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 17779 000017D1 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 17780                                  
 17781                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17782                                  
 17783                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17784                                  
 17785                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 17786                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 17787                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 17788                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 17789                                  ;
 17790                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 17791                                  
 17792                                  		; 19/10/2022
 17793                                  find_bds:	
 17794 000017D3 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 17795                                  fbds_1:					
 17796 000017D7 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 17797 000017DB 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 17798 000017DD 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 17799                                  					; go to next bds
 17800 000017E0 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 17801 000017E3 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 17802 000017E5 F9                      		stc
 17803                                  fdbs_2:					
 17804 000017E6 C3                      		retn
 17805                                  
 17806                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17807                                  
 17808                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17809                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17810                                  doint:
 17811                                  		; 10/12/2022
 17812 000017E7 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 17813                                  					; get physical drive number
 17814                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 17815                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 17816                                  		
 17817 000017EA 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 17818 000017EC 08C0                    		or	al, al
 17819 000017EE 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 17820                                  		; 10/12/2022
 17821 000017F0 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 17822                                  					; get request code
 17823                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 17824 000017F3 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 17825                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 17826 000017F6 9D                      		popf
 17827                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 17828                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17829 000017F7 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 17830                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 17831                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 17832 000017FC 9C                      		pushf
 17833                                  		; 10/12/2022
 17834 000017FD 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 17835                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 17836                                  dointdone:				
 17837 00001800 C3                      		retn
 17838                                  
 17839                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17840                                  
 17841                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17842                                  
 17843                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 17844                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 17845                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 17846                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 17847                                  ;
 17848                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 17849                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 17850                                  ;
 17851                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 17852                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 17853                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 17854                                  
 17855                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 17856                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 17857                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 17858                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 17859                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 17860                                  ;.olddx: resw
 17861                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 17862                                  ;.olddd: resd
 17863                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 17864                                  ;end struc
 17865                                  
 17866                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17867                                  
 17868                                  ;   entry conditions:
 17869                                  ;	ah = function
 17870                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 17871                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 17872                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 17873                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 17874                                  ;   output conditions:
 17875                                  ;	no dma violation.
 17876                                  
 17877                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 17878                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 17879                                  ;
 17880                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 17881                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 17882                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 17883                                  
 17884                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17885                                  
 17886                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17887                                  
 17888                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17889                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1889h
 17890                                  dtype_array:
 17891 00001801 90004000                		dd 400090h		; 40h:90h is drive type array addr
 17892                                  
 17893                                  ; 17/10/2022
 17894                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 17895                                  ; 09/12/2022
 17896                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 17897                                  
 17898                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17899                                  
 17900                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 17901                                  
 17902                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 17903                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 17904                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 17905                                  
 17906                                  format_special_stuff:
 17907 00001805 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 17908 0000180A 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 17909 0000180C 53                      		push	bx
 17910 0000180D BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 17911 00001810 E85104                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 17912 00001813 5B                      		pop	bx
 17913 00001814 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 17914                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17915                                  
 17916                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17917                                  
 17918                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 17919                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 17920                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 17921                                  
 17922                                  		; 19/10/2022
 17923                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 17924 00001816 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 17925 00001818 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 17926 0000181A 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 17927 0000181B 51                      		push	cx
 17928 0000181C 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 17929 0000181E B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 17930 00001820 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 17931 00001822 8406[A204]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 17932 00001826 59                      		pop	cx
 17933 00001827 58                      		pop	ax
 17934 00001828 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 17935                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 17936 0000182A 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 17937 0000182B 06                      		push	es
 17938                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17939 0000182C 2EC41E[0118]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 17940                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 17941                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 17942 00001831 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 17943 00001833 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 17944 00001836 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 17945                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 17946                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 17947 0000183A 07                      		pop	es
 17948 0000183B 5B                      		pop	bx
 17949 0000183C EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 17950                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17951                                  
 17952                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17953                                  
 17954                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 17955                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 17956                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 17957                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 17958                                  
 17959                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 17960 0000183E 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 17961                                  					; read driver parm ?
 17962 00001843 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 17963 00001845 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 17964                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 17965 0000184A 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 17966                                  ps2_30_problem:
 17967 0000184C 50                      		push	ax
 17968 0000184D B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 17969                                  		; 26/12/2023
 17970                                  		;call	70h:70Bh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM BIOSCODE:18D7h
 17971                                  		;		 ; call BIOSDATA:call_orig13	
 17972                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 17973                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17974 0000184F 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 17975                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 17976                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 17977 00001854 58                      		pop	ax
 17978 00001855 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 17979                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17980                                  
 17981                                  ; 17/10/2022
 17982                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17983                                  
 17984                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 17985                                  
 17986                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 17987                                  
 17988                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 17989                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 17990                                  
 17991                                  		; 19/10/2022
 17992 00001857 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 17993                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 17994                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 17995 00001858 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 17996                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 17997                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 17998                                  
 17999                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 18000                                  
 18001 0000185D A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 18002 00001860 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 18003 00001863 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 18004                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 18005                                  format_special_stuff_done:
 18006 00001865 803E[A204]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 18007 0000186A 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 18008                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 18009                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 18010                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18011                                  		;call	70h:70Bh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM BIOSCODE:18EDh
 18012                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 18013 0000186C 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18014                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18015                                  		
 18016 00001871 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 18017                                  		
 18018 00001872 803E[AF05]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 18019                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 18020 00001877 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 18021                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 18022                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 18023 00001879 9D                      		popf
 18024 0000187A 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 18025                                  ret_from_i13:
 18026 0000187C 1F                      		pop	ds
 18027 0000187D CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 18028                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18029                                  
 18030                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 18031                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 18032                                  ; a changeline error.
 18033                                  
 18034                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 18035 00001880 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 18036                                  i13_ret_error:				
 18037 00001882 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 18038 00001885 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 18039 00001887 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 18040 00001889 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 18041 0000188B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 18042 00001890 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 18043                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 18044                                  					; never	would
 18045 00001892 53                      		push	bx
 18046 00001893 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 18047 00001896 E8CB03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 18048 00001899 5B                      		pop	bx
 18049                                  int13b:
 18050 0000189A F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 18051 0000189B EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 18052                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18053                                  
 18054                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 18055                                  
 18056                                  goterr13:
 18057 0000189D 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 18058 000018A0 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 18059                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 18060 000018A2 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 18061 000018A5 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 18062 000018A7 803E[A905]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 18063 000018AC 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 18064                                  
 18065 000018AE 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 18066                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 18067                                  					; (2 = romread)
 18068                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 18069 000018B3 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 18070                                  
 18071 000018B5 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 18072                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 18073                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18074 000018B7 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18075                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18076                                  					; call far 70:797h
 18077 000018BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 18078 000018BF 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 18079 000018C1 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 18080 000018C3 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 18081 000018C5 53                      		push	bx
 18082 000018C6 51                      		push	cx
 18083 000018C7 52                      		push	dx
 18084 000018C8 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 18085                                  loop_ecc:
 18086 000018CB B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 18087                                  
 18088                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 18089                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 18090                                  ;
 18091                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 18092                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 18093                                  ; track.
 18094                                  ;
 18095                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 18096                                  ; this request.
 18097                                  ;
 18098                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 18099                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 18100                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 18101                                  ;
 18102 000018CE E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 18103                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 18104                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18105 000018D1 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18106                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18107 000018D6 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 18108 000018D8 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 18109 000018DB 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 18110 000018DD 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 18111 000018E0 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 18112                                  		; 10/12/2022
 18113                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 18114                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 18115 000018E2 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 18116                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 18117                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 18118                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 18119                                  ok11_op:
 18120 000018E4 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 18121 000018E8 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 18122 000018EA FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 18123                                  					; add 200h to address
 18124 000018EC FEC7                    		inc	bh
 18125 000018EE FEC7                    		inc	bh
 18126 000018F0 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 18127                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18128                                  
 18129                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 18130                                  
 18131                                  ok11_exit_err:
 18132 000018F2 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 18133                                  ok11_exit:
 18134 000018F3 5A                      		pop	dx
 18135 000018F4 59                      		pop	cx
 18136 000018F5 5B                      		pop	bx
 18137 000018F6 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 18138                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18139                                  
 18140                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 18141                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 18142                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 18143                                  
 18144                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 18145 000018F8 06                      		push	es
 18146 000018F9 53                      		push	bx
 18147 000018FA BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 18148 000018FD 1E                      		push	ds
 18149 000018FE 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 18150 000018FF B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 18151                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 18152                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18153 00001902 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18154                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18155 00001907 5B                      		pop	bx
 18156 00001908 07                      		pop	es
 18157 00001909 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 18158 0000190B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 18159 0000190E 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 18160                                  
 18161                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 18162                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 18163                                  
 18164                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 18165 00001910 56                      		push	si
 18166 00001911 57                      		push	di
 18167 00001912 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 18168 00001914 BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 18169 00001917 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 18170 0000191A 5F                      		pop	di
 18171 0000191B 5E                      		pop	si
 18172 0000191C EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 18173                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18174                                  
 18175                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 18176                                  ; operation as best we can.
 18177                                  
 18178                                  gotdmaerr:
 18179 0000191E A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 18180 00001921 FB                      		sti
 18181 00001922 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 18182 00001925 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 18183                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 18184                                  					; functions we don't handle
 18185 00001927 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 18186 0000192A 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 18187 0000192C 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 18188 0000192F 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 18189 00001931 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 18190                                  
 18191                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 18192                                  
 18193                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 18194                                  
 18195 00001933 52                      		push	dx
 18196 00001934 51                      		push	cx
 18197 00001935 53                      		push	bx
 18198 00001936 50                      		push	ax
 18199 00001937 55                      		push	bp
 18200 00001938 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 18201 0000193A 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 18202                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18203                                  		;add	dx, dx
 18204                                  		;add	dx, dx
 18205                                  		;add	dx, dx
 18206                                  		;add	dx, dx		; dx = dx*16
 18207 0000193C D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 18208 0000193E D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 18209 00001940 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 18210 00001942 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 18211 00001944 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 18212 00001946 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 18213                                  
 18214                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 18215                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 18216                                  
 18217 0000194A 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 18218 0000194C E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 18219                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18220                                  
 18221                                  no_skip_first:
 18222 0000194F D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 18223 00001951 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 18224 00001953 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 18225                                  
 18226                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 18227                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 18228                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 18229                                  ;
 18230                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 18231                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 18232                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 18233                                  ; in error.
 18234                                  
 18235 00001955 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 18236 00001957 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 18237                                  
 18238                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 18239                                  
 18240 00001959 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 18241                                  					; set up head number
 18242 0000195C E888FE                  		call	doint
 18243 0000195F E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 18244                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18245                                  
 18246                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 18247 00001962 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 18248 00001964 F9                      		stc
 18249 00001965 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 18250                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 18251                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18252                                  
 18253                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 18254                                  
 18255                                  intverify:
 18256 00001968 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 18257 00001969 53                      		push	bx
 18258 0000196A 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 18259 0000196B 07                      		pop	es
 18260                                  dosimple:
 18261 0000196C BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 18262                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 18263                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 18264                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18265 0000196F 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18266                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18267 00001974 5B                      		pop	bx
 18268 00001975 07                      		pop	es
 18269 00001976 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 18270                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18271                                  
 18272                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 18273                                  
 18274                                  intformat:
 18275 00001979 06                      		push	es
 18276 0000197A 53                      		push	bx
 18277 0000197B 56                      		push	si
 18278 0000197C 57                      		push	di
 18279 0000197D 1E                      		push	ds
 18280                                  
 18281                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 18282                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 18283                                  
 18284 0000197E 06                      		push	es
 18285 0000197F 1E                      		push	ds
 18286 00001980 07                      		pop	es
 18287 00001981 1F                      		pop	ds
 18288 00001982 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 18289 00001984 BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector
 18290 00001987 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 18291 0000198A 1F                      		pop	ds
 18292 0000198B 5F                      		pop	di
 18293 0000198C 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 18294 0000198D EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 18295                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18296                                  
 18297                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 18298                                  ; the first block.
 18299                                  ;
 18300                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 18301                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 18302                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 18303                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 18304                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 18305                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 18306                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 18307                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 18308                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 18309                                  
 18310                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18311                                  doblock:
 18312                                  
 18313                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 18314                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 18315                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 18316                                  				
 18317 0000198F 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18318                                  					; get head #, drive #
 18319 00001992 51                      		push	cx
 18320 00001993 06                      		push	es
 18321 00001994 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 18322                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 18323 00001995 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 18324 00001998 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 18325                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18326 0000199C 26F6453F01              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 1
 18327                                  		; 12/12/2022
 18328                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 18329                                  		;;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 18330 000019A1 5F                      		pop	di
 18331 000019A2 07                      		pop	es
 18332 000019A3 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 18333 000019A5 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 18334 000019A7 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 18335 000019A9 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 18336                                  doblockflop:
 18337 000019AB 59                      		pop	cx
 18338                                  doblockcontinue:
 18339 000019AC 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 18340 000019AE 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 18341 000019B0 50                      		push	ax
 18342 000019B1 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 18343 000019B3 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 18344                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18345                                  
 18346                                  doblocklast:
 18347 000019B5 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 18348 000019B7 50                      		push	ax
 18349                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 18350 000019B8 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 18351 000019BB 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 18352 000019BD 58                      		pop	ax
 18353 000019BE 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 18354                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 18355 000019C1 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 18356 000019C3 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 18357 000019C5 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 18358 000019C7 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 18359 000019C9 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 18360                                  					; then we are done already.
 18361 000019CB 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 18362                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 18363 000019CD E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 18364 000019D0 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 18365                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18366                                  
 18367                                  bufferx:
 18368 000019D2 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 18369                                  					; set up head number
 18370                                  buffer:
 18371 000019D5 53                      		push	bx
 18372 000019D6 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 18373 000019D9 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 18374 000019DC 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 18375                                  					
 18376                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 18377                                  
 18378 000019DE 06                      		push	es
 18379 000019DF 1E                      		push	ds
 18380 000019E0 56                      		push	si
 18381 000019E1 57                      		push	di
 18382 000019E2 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 18383 000019E3 06                      		push	es
 18384 000019E4 1F                      		pop	ds
 18385 000019E5 07                      		pop	es
 18386 000019E6 BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 18387 000019E9 57                      		push	di		; save it
 18388 000019EA 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 18389 000019EC E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 18390 000019EF 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 18391                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 18392 000019F0 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 18393 000019F1 5E                      		pop	si
 18394 000019F2 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 18395                                  
 18396                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 18397                                  
 18398 000019F3 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18399                                  					; get drive number
 18400 000019F5 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 18401 000019F8 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 18402                                  					;
 18403                                  					; ah is	function
 18404                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 18405                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 18406                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 18407                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 18408                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 18409 000019FB E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 18410 000019FE 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 18411 000019FF 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 18412 00001A01 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 18413                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18414                                  
 18415                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 18416                                  
 18417                                  doread:
 18418 00001A03 06                      		push	es
 18419 00001A04 53                      		push	bx
 18420 00001A05 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 18421 00001A06 07                      		pop	es
 18422 00001A07 BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 18423 00001A0A B001                    		mov	al, 1
 18424 00001A0C 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18425                                  					; get drive number
 18426 00001A0F E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 18427                                  					; ah = function
 18428                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 18429                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 18430                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 18431 00001A12 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 18432 00001A15 5B                      		pop	bx
 18433 00001A16 07                      		pop	es
 18434 00001A17 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 18435 00001A19 56                      		push	si
 18436 00001A1A 57                      		push	di
 18437 00001A1B 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 18438 00001A1D BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 18439 00001A20 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 18440 00001A23 5F                      		pop	di
 18441 00001A24 5E                      		pop	si
 18442                                  
 18443                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 18444                                  
 18445                                  dotail:
 18446 00001A25 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 18447 00001A26 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 18448 00001A29 41                      		inc	cx
 18449 00001A2A 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 18450 00001A2D F8                      		clc
 18451 00001A2E FEC8                    		dec	al
 18452 00001A30 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 18453                                  
 18454                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 18455                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 18456                                  
 18457 00001A32 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18458 00001A35 E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 18459 00001A38 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 18460                                  
 18461                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 18462                                  
 18463                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 18464                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 18465                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 18466                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 18467                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 18468                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 18469                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 18470                                  
 18471                                  bad13:
 18472 00001A3B 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 18473 00001A3D 5D                      		pop	bp
 18474 00001A3E 5B                      		pop	bx
 18475 00001A3F 5B                      		pop	bx
 18476 00001A40 59                      		pop	cx
 18477 00001A41 5A                      		pop	dx
 18478 00001A42 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 18479 00001A44 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 18480                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18481                                  
 18482                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:	
 18483 00001A47 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 18484

 18486                                  		; 10/12/2022
 18487                                  		;db 	0

 18509                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18510                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 18511                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 18512                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 18513                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18514                                  
 18515                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18516                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1AE0h
 18517                                  install_bds:
 18518 00001A56 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 18519 00001A57 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 18520                                  
 18521                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 18522                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 18523                                  loop_next_bds:
 18524 00001A5A C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 18525                                  					; fetch	next bds
 18526 00001A5C 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 18527 00001A60 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 18528                                  					; drive	with new one?
 18529 00001A63 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 18530 00001A65 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 18531                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18532 00001A67 26085D3F                		or	[es:di+3Fh], bl
 18533                                  		;or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 18534                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 18535 00001A6B 085C3F                  		or	[si+3Fh], bl
 18536                                  		;or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 18537 00001A6E 2680653FDF              		and	byte [es:di+3Fh], 0DFh
 18538                                  		;and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 18539                                  					; we don't own it
 18540 00001A73 8A5C3F                  		mov	bl, [si+3Fh]
 18541                                  		;mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 18542                                  					; determine if changeline available
 18543 00001A76 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 18544 00001A79 26085D3F                		or	[es:di+3Fh], bl
 18545                                  		;or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 18546                                  next_bds:
 18547                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 18548 00001A7D B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 18549 00001A80 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 18550                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 18551                                  					; are we at end	of list?

 18558                                  					; set next pointer to null
 18559 00001A8C 1F                      		pop	ds
