 24829                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24830                                  ;
 24831                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 24832                                  ;
 24833                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 24834                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 24835                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 24836                                  ;
 24837                                  ; Inputs : None
 24838                                  ;
 24839                                  ; Outputs : None
 24840                                  ;
 24841                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 24842                                  ;
 24843                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24844                                  
 24845                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24846                                  
 24847                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 24848 00000C54 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 24849 00000C56 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 24850                                  
 24851                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 24852                                  
 24853                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24854 00000C58 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 24855                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 24856 00000C5B 2EA3[300C]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 24857 00000C5F A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 24858                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 24859 00000C62 2EA3[320C]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 24860                                  
 24861                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 24862                                  
 24863 00000C66 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 24864                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 24865                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24866 00000C68 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 24867 00000C6B CD21                    	int	21h
 24868                                  
 24869                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 24870                                  
 24871 00000C6D 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 24872 00000C6E 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 24873                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 24874 00000C70 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 24875                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 24876 00000C77 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC' ; 4353h
 24877 00000C7E 40                      	inc	ax
 24878 00000C7F 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 24879                                  
 24880                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 24881                                  
 24882 00000C81 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 24883                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 24884 00000C82 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 24885 00000C88 A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 24886                                  
 24887                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 24888                                  
 24889                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 24890 00000C8B B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 24891 00000C8E BE[000C]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 24892 00000C91 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 24893 00000C93 0E                      	push	cs
 24894 00000C94 1F                      	pop	ds
 24895 00000C95 FC                      	cld
 24896 00000C96 F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 24897 00000C98 FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 24898                                  
 24899                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 24900                                  
 24901                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24902 00000C99 57                      	push	di
 24903 00000C9A 06                      	push	es
 24904                                  
 24905                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 24906                                  	;mov	es,ax
 24907                                  	; 03/09/2023
 24908 00000C9B 49                      	dec	cx
 24909                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 24910 00000C9C 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 24911                                  
 24912 00000C9E BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 24913                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)
 24914 00000CA1 B92000                  	mov	cx,32
 24915 00000CA4 BE[340C]                	mov	si,VDiskHMAHead
 24916 00000CA7 F3A4                    	rep	movsb			; ds already set to cs
 24917                                  
 24918 00000CA9 5F                      	pop	di
 24919 00000CAA 07                      	pop	es
 24920                                  
 24921 00000CAB C3                      	retn
 24922                                  
 24923                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24924                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 24925                                  ;
 24926                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 24927                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 24928                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 24929                                  ;
 24930                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24931                                  
 24932                                  struc desc
 24933 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 24934 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 24935 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 24936 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 24937 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 24938                                   .size:
 24939                                  endstruc
 24940                                  
 24941                                  		; 23/10/2022
 24942                                  bmove:		;label byte
 24943                                  
 24944                                  dummy:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 24945 00000CAC 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0		 
 24946                                  gdt:		;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 24947 00000CB4 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 24948 00000CBC FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 24949 00000CBE 0000                    		dw	0
 24950 00000CC0 00                      		db	0
 24951 00000CC1 93                      		db	93h
 24952 00000CC2 0000                    		dw	0
 24953 00000CC4 FFFF                    tgt_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,10h,93h,0>  ; 1MB
 24954 00000CC6 0000                    		dw	0
 24955 00000CC8 10                      		db	10h
 24956 00000CC9 93                      		db	93h
 24957 00000CCA 0000                    		dw	0

 24960 00000CCC 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 24961                                  temp_stack:	;times desc.size db 0	; desc	<>
 24962 00000CD4 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 24963                                  
 24964 00000CDC 00<rep 20h>             ClrdVDISKHead:	times 32 db 0		; db 32 dup (0)
 24965                                  
 24966                                  
 24967                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 24968                                  
 24969                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 24970                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 24971                                  
 24972                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 24973                                  
 24974                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 24975                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 24976                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 24977                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 24978                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 24979                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 24980                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 24981                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 24982                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 24983                                  ;								      ;I070
 24984                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 24985                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 24986                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 24987                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 24988                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 24989                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 24990                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 24991                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 24992                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 24993                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 24994                                  ;								      ;I070
 24995                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 24996                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 24997                                  
 24998                                  	; 30/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 24999                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:0DBAh
 25000                                  ClrVDISKHeader:
 25001 00000CFC E464                    	in	al,64h	; 8042 keyboard controller status register
 25002                                  			; 7:  PERR    1=parity error in data received from keyboard
 25003                                  			;    +----------- AT Mode ----------+------------ PS/2 Mode ------------+
 25004                                  			; 6: |RxTO    receive (Rx) timeout  | TO     general timeout (Rx or Tx) |
 25005                                  			; 5: |TxTO    transmit (Tx) timeout | MOBF   mouse output buffer full   |
 25006                                  			;    +------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
 25007                                  			; 4:  INH     0=keyboard communications inhibited
 25008                                  			; 3:  A2      0=60h was the port last written to, 1=64h was last
 25009                                  			; 2:  SYS     distinguishes reset types: 0=cold reboot, 1=warm reboot
 25010                                  			; 1:  IBF     1=input buffer full (keyboard can't accept data)
 25011                                  			; 0:  OBF     1=output buffer full (data from keyboard is available)
 25012 00000CFE A810                    	test	al,10h	; test bit 4 - Is keyboard inhibited?
 25013 00000D00 7511                    	jnz	short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move
 25014                                  	; 30/12/2023
 25015                                  	; ds = cs	
 25016 00000D02 813E[BB02]F819          	cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h ; check for TORTUGA models
 25017 00000D08 7408                    	jz	short ClrVDISKno ; do not use INT 15h block move code
 25018                                  				 ; (while 8042 is disabled)
 25019 00000D0A 813E[BB02]FC09          	cmp	word [sys_model_byte],9FCh ; check for PS/2 30-286 model
 25020 00000D10 7501                    	jnz	short ClrVDISKok
 25021                                  ClrVDISKno:
 25022 00000D12 C3                      	retn
 25023                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 25024                                  	; 30/12/2023
 25025                                  ClrVDISKok:
 25026                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25027                                  	; ds = cs
 25028                                  
 25029                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 25030                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 25031                                  
 25032 00000D13 06                      	push	es
 25033 00000D14 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 25034 00000D16 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 25035 00000D18 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 25036 00000D1A D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 25037 00000D1C B104                    	mov	cl,4
 25038 00000D1E D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 25039 00000D20 05[DC0C]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 25040 00000D23 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 25041                                  
 25042                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 25043                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 25044                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 25045                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 25046                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 25047                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25048                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 25049 00000D26 A3[BE0C]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 25050                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 25051 00000D29 8816[C00C]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 25052                                  
 25053 00000D2D B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 25054 00000D30 0E                      	push	cs
 25055 00000D31 07                      	pop	es
 25056 00000D32 BE[AC0C]                	mov	si,bmove
 25057 00000D35 B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 25058 00000D37 CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 25059                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 25060                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 25061                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 25062 00000D39 07                      	pop	es
 25063 00000D3A C3                      	retn

 25069                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.

 25152                                  ; procedure : CPMHack

 25154                                  ;		Copies the code from 0:c0 into ffff:0d0h
 25155                                  ;		for CPM compatibility

 25168 00000D8D BEC000                  	mov	si,0C0h

 25171 00000D93 B105                    	mov	cl,5

 25173 00000D96 F3A4                    	rep	movsb		; move 5 bytes from 0:C0 to FFFF:D0
 25174 00000D98 1F                      	pop	ds

 26199                                  
 26200                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 26201                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 26202                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 26203                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 26204                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 26205                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 26206                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 26207                                  ;
 26208                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 26209                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 26210                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 26211                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 26212                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 26213                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 26214                                  ;
 26215                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 26216                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 26217                                  ;
 26218                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 26219                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 26220                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 26221                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 26222                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 26223                                  ;
 26224                                  ;	for round-up machine
 26225                                  ;
 26226                                  ;			  none.
 26227                                  
 26228                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 26229                                  ;
 26230                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 26231                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 26232                                  
 26233                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26234                                  
 26235 000011B1 50                      	push	ax
 26236 000011B2 53                      	push	bx
 26237 000011B3 52                      	push	dx
 26238 000011B4 06                      	push	es
 26239                                  
 26240 000011B5 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;reset h/w by writing to port
 26241 000011B7 BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 26242 000011BA EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh
 26243 000011BB 42                      	inc	dx
 26244 000011BC EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f3h,0ffh
 26245 000011BD 42                      	inc	dx
 26246 000011BE EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f4h,0ffh
 26247 000011BF 42                      	inc	dx
 26248 000011C0 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f5h,0ffh
 26249 000011C1 42                      	inc	dx
 26250 000011C2 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f6h,0ffh
 26251 000011C3 42                      	inc	dx
 26252 000011C4 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f7h,0ffh
 26253                                  
 26254                                  ;sb secondary global rearm
 26255

 26272                                  startrearm:

 26274 000011E1 BAF206                  	mov	dx,6F2h 		;get starting address
 26275 000011E4 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f2h,0ffh
 26276 000011E5 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 26277 000011E6 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f3h,0ffh
 26278 000011E7 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address
 26279 000011E8 EE                      	out	dx,al			;out 06f4h,0ffh
 26280 000011E9 42                      	inc	dx			;bump address

 26436                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26437                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26438                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 26439                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26440                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 26441                                  ;
 26442                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 26443                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 26444                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 26445                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 26446                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 26447                                  ; program).
 26448                                  
 26449                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 26450                                  
 26451                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 26452                                  
 26453 00001299 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 26454                                  
 26455                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 26456                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 26457                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 26458                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 26459                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 26460                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 26461                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 26462                                  ; carridge return.
 26463                                  
 26464                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 26465                                  ;character after =.
 26466                                  
 26467 0000129A 06                      	push	es
 26468 0000129B 1E                      	push	ds
 26469 0000129C 07                      	pop	es
 26470 0000129D 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 26471 0000129E 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 26472                                  
 26473 000012A0 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26474 000012A2 FC                      	cld
 26475 000012A3 2EC606[F102]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 26476 000012A9 BF[F202]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 26477                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 26478 000012AC AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 26479                                  	; 05/09/2023
 26480 000012AD 08C0                    	or	al,al
 26481                                  	;cmp	al,0
 26482                                  	;je	short got_installparm
 26483                                  	;jmp	short installfilename
 26484                                  	; 10/04/2024
 26485 000012AF 75FB                    	jnz	short installfilename
 26486                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 26487 000012B1 AC                      	lodsb
 26488 000012B2 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 26489 000012B5 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 26490 000012B7 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 26491 000012B9 FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 26492 000012BB 47                      	inc	di
 26493 000012BC EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 26494                                  done_installparm:
 26495 000012BE 2E880E[F002]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 26496                                  	; 05/09/2023
 26497 000012C3 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 26498                                  	;cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 26499 000012C5 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 26500 000012C7 2EC606[F102]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 26501                                  					; starts with cr.

 26504 000012CD 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx

 26510                                  ;
 26511                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 26512                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 26513                                  ;

 26610                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26611                                  
 26612                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 26613                                  ;
 26614                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 26615                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 26616                                  ;
 26617                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 26618                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 26619                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 26620                                  
 26621                                  ParaRound:
 26622 00001315 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 26623 00001318 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 26624 0000131A D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 26625 0000131C D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 26626 0000131E D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 26627 00001320 C3                      	retn
 26628                                  
 26629                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26630                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 26631                                  ;
 26632                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 26633                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 26634                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 26635                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 26636                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 26637                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 26638                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 26639                                  ;
 26640                                  ;in: after relocation,
 26641                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 26642                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 26643                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 26644                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 26645                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 26646                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 26647                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 26648                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 26649                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 26650                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 26651                                  ;
 26652                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 26653                                  
 26654                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26655                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 26656                                  sysinit_base:				
 26657 00001321 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 26658 00001326 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 26659 0000132B CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 26660 0000132D 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 26661 00001332 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 26662 00001337 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 26663 00001338 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 26664 00001339 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 26665                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 26666                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 26667 0000133B E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 26668 0000133E 263906[DA02]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 26669 00001343 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 26670                                  
 26671                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 26672                                  
 26673 00001345 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 26674 00001347 0E                      	push	cs
 26675 00001348 1F                      	pop	ds
 26676                                  	; 30/12/2022
 26677                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 26678                                  	;mov	dx,102
 26679 00001349 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 26680                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 26681 0000134C CD21                    	int	21h
 26682                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 26683                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 26684                                  
 26685                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 26686                                  stall:
 26687                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26688                                  _stall: 
 26689                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26690 0000134E F4                      	hlt 
 26691                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26692                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 26693 0000134F EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 26694                                  
 26695                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 26696 00001351 26FF2E[D602]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 26697                                  
 26698                                  ;-------------------------------------
 26699                                  
 26700                                  sum_up:
 26701                                  
 26702                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 26703                                  ;out:  ax - result
 26704                                  ;
 26705                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 26706                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 26707                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 26708                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 26709                                  ;
 26710                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 26711                                  
 26712 00001356 1E                      	push	ds
 26713                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26714                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 26715 00001357 26A1[A302]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 26716                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26717                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 26718 0000135B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 26719 0000135D 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 26720 0000135F 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 26721 00001361 268B0E[D002]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 26722                                  					; whole test better fail.
 26723 00001366 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 26724 00001368 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 26725                                  sum1:
 26726 0000136A 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 26727 0000136C 46                      	inc	si
 26728 0000136D 46                      	inc	si
 26729 0000136E E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 26730                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 26731                                  sum_sys_code:
 26732                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26733 00001370 BE7013                  	mov	si,locstack ;; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26734                                  			    ;; 532h (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26735                                  			    ; 10/04/2024	
 26736                                  			    ; 586h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, SYSINIT)	
 26737                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 26738                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 26739                                  	;;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 26740                                  	; 02/11/2022
 26741                                  	;;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 26742                                  	; 10/04/2024
 26743                                  	;mov	cx,5B40h  ; (23360) for PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT)	
 26744                                  	; 30/12/2022  
 26745 00001373 B9[1054]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 26746 00001376 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 26747 00001378 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 26748                                  sum2:
 26749 0000137A 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 26750 0000137D 46                      	inc	si
 26751 0000137E 46                      	inc	si
 26752 0000137F E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 26753 00001381 1F                      	pop	ds
 26754 00001382 C3                      	retn
 26755                                  
 26756                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26757                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS 4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26758                                  ; (SYSINIT:12F2h)
 26759                                  ; 10/04/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, SYSINIT)
 26760                                  ; (SYSINIT:149Dh)
 26761                                  
 26762                                  sysinit_base_ss equ $-sysinit_base  ; = 61 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:115Ch)
 26763                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:			    ; = 62 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:1290h)

 26765                                  sysinit_base_ssx:	
 26766 00001383 0000                    	dw	0

 26769                                  				    ; = 64 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, SYSINIT:1440h)

 26786                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26787                                  ; Set_Buffer
 26788                                  ;
 26789                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 26790                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 26791                                  ;
 26792                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 26793                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 26794                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 26795                                  ;
 26796                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 26797                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 26798                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26799                                  
 26800                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26801                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 26802                                  
 26803                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 26804                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:14BCh)
 26805                                  
 26806                                  set_buffer:
 26807 000013A2 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 26808 000013A4 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 26809 000013A7 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1
 26810 000013A9 B201                    	mov	dl,1				; buffers in HMA
 26811                                  set_buff_1:
 26812                                  	; 25/10/2022
 26813                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q
 26814 000013AB 893F                    	mov	[bx],di
 26815                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es
 26816 000013AD 8C4702                  	mov	[bx+2],es
 26817                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Dirty_Buff_Count],0 ;set dirty_count to 0.
 26818 000013B0 C747040000              	mov	word [bx+4],0
 26819                                  
 26820 000013B5 89F8                    	mov	ax,di
 26821 000013B7 2E8B0E[9902]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]
 26822 000013BC 57                      	push	di				; remember first buffer
 26823                                  
 26824                                  ;	for each buffer
 26825                                  
 26826                                  nxt_buff:

 26828 000013C0 89C7                    	mov	di,ax
 26829 000013C2 E2F9                    	loop	nxt_buff
 26830                                  
 26831 000013C4 2E2B3E[9D02]            	sub	di,[cs:singlebuffersize]	; point to last buffer
 26832

 26834                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],cx	; last->next = first
 26835 000013CA 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx

 26838                                  	; 25/10/2022
 26839 000013CF 26894D02                	mov	[es:di+2],cx
 26840                                  
 26841 000013D3 08D2                    	or	dl,dl				; In HMa ?
 26842 000013D5 7417                    	jz	short set_buff_2		; no
 26843                                  	;mov	byte [bx+BUFFINF.Buff_In_HMA],1
 26844 000013D7 C6470C01                	mov	byte [bx+12],1
 26845 000013DB 2EA1[6403]              	mov	ax,[cs:memhi]			; seg of scratch buff
 26846                                  	;mov	word [bx+BUFFINF.Lo_Mem_Buff],0	; offset of sctarch buff is 0

 26849 000013E4 89470F                  	mov	word [bx+15],ax

 26851                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

 26853                                  	;;sub	ax,bufinsiz ; 20		; buffer head not required
 26854                                  	;sub	ax,20
 26855 000013EB 83E818                  	sub	ax,24 ; bufinsiz		; (bufinsiz is 24 in PCDOS 7.1)
 26856                                  
 26857                                  set_buff_2:
 26858 000013EE 2E0106[6203]            	add	[cs:memlo],ax
 26859                                  	;or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],for_devmark ; 2
 26860 000013F3 2E800E[6919]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2
 26861                                  	;call	round
 26862                                  	;retn

 26864 000013F9 E9F633                  	jmp	round

 26866                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26867                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 26868                                  ;
 26869                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 26870                                  ;
 26871                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 26872                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 26873                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26874                                  
 26875                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 26876                                  GetBufferAddr:
 26877 000013FC 53                      	push	bx
 26878 000013FD 52                      	push	dx
 26879                                  
 26880                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26881                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
 26882                                  	;;;
 26883 000013FE 2E803E[6E03]02          	cmp	byte [cs:dosdata_umb],2
 26884                                  				; is dosdata moved to UMB ? (DOSDATA=UMB done)
 26885 00001404 7506                    	jne	short gba_1     ; no
 26886 00001406 837F02FF                	cmp	word [bx+2],0FFFFh ; is the buffer (already) in HMA ?
 26887 0000140A 7423                    	je	short gba_2	; yes
 26888                                  gba_1:
 26889                                  	;;;
 26890                                  
 26891 0000140C 2EA1[9D02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 26892 00001410 2EF726[9902]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 26893                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 26894 00001415 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 26895                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26896                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 26897                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26898 00001418 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 26899 0000141A 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 26900 0000141C B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 26901                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 26902 0000141F CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; DOS 5+ - ALLOCATE HMA SPACE
 26903                                  			;     AX = 4A02h
 26904                                  			;     BX = number of bytes
 26905                                  			; Return:
 26906                                  			;     ES:DI -> start of allocated HMA block or FFFFh:FFFFh
 26907                                  			;     BX = number of bytes actually allocated
 26908                                  			;	   (rounded up to next paragraph)
 26909                                  			; Notes:
 26910                                  			;     this call is not valid unless DOS is loaded in the HMA
 26911                                  			;     (DOS=HIGH)
 26912                                  
 26913 00001421 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 26914 00001424 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 26915                                  	
 26916                                  	;mov	di,0		; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 26917                                  	; 05/09/2023
 26918                                  	; zf=1
 26919 00001426 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 26920                                  	; zf=1
 26921                                  	
 26922                                  	;zf=1
 26923                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 26924                                  	;zf=1
 26925 00001427 2E8E06[6403]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 26926                                  got_hma:
 26927 0000142C 5A                      	pop	dx
 26928 0000142D 5B                      	pop	bx
 26929 0000142E C3                      	retn
 26930                                  
 26931                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26932                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
 26933                                  	;;;
 26934                                  gba_2:
 26935 0000142F C43F                    	les	di,[bx]
 26936 00001431 09FF                    	or	di,di
 26937                                  	;pop	dx
 26938                                  	;pop	bx
 26939                                  	;retn
 26940                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26941 00001433 EBF7                    	jmp	short got_hma
 26942                                  	;;;

 26946                                  set_buffer_info:
 26947                                  
 26948                                  ;function: set buf_link,buf_id,buf_sector
 26949                                  ;
 26950                                  ;in: es:di -> buffer header to be set.
 26951                                  ;    ax = di
 26952                                  ;
 26953                                  ;out:
 26954                                  ;    above entries set.

 26962                                  	;mov	[es:di+buffinfo.buf_next],ax
 26963 00001447 268905                  	mov	[es:di],ax
 26964                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_ID],00FFh  ; new buffer free
 26965 0000144A 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh
 26966                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector],0   ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 26967 00001450 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 26968                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 26969 00001456 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 26970 0000145C C3                      	retn
 26971                                  
 26972                                  ; ======================================================================
 26973                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 26974                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26975                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26976                                  
 26977                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26978                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 26979                                  ;
 26980                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 26981                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 26982                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 26983                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 26984                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 26985                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 26986                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 26987                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 26988                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 26989                                  ;
 26990                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 26991                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 26992                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 26993                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 26994                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 26995                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 26996                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 26997                                  ;	conditions:
 26998                                  ;
 26999                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 27000                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 27001                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 27002                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 27003                                  ;
 27004                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 27005                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 27006                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 27007                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 27008                                  ;
 27009                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 27010                                  ;
 27011                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 27012                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 27013                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 27014                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 27015                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 27016                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 27017                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 27018                                  ;	interrupt line.
 27019                                  ;
 27020                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 27021                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 27022                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 27023                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 27024                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 27025                                  ;
 27026                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 27027                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 27028                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 27029                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 27030                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 27031                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 27032                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 27033                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 27034                                  ;
 27035                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 27036                                  
 27037                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 27038                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 27039                                  
 27040                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 27041                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:157Ch)
 27042                                  
 27043                                  	; 14/12/2022
 27044                                  stackinit:
 27045 0000145D 50                      	push	ax
 27046 0000145E 1E                      	push	ds
 27047 0000145F 06                      	push	es
 27048 00001460 53                      	push	bx
 27049 00001461 51                      	push	cx
 27050 00001462 52                      	push	dx
 27051 00001463 57                      	push	di
 27052 00001464 56                      	push	si
 27053 00001465 55                      	push	bp
 27054                                  
 27055                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 27056                                  
 27057                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27058                                  	; ds = cs
 27059 00001466 A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 27060 00001469 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 27061                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27062                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 27063                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 27064 0000146B 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 27065                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 27066 0000146F A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 27067 00001472 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 27068                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27069 00001476 A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 27070                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27071                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 27072                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 27073 00001479 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 27074                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27075 0000147D 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 27076 0000147F A1[9202]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 27077                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 27078                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 27079                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 27080 00001482 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 27081                                  
 27082                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 27083                                  
 27084                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 27085                                  
 27086                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 27087                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27088                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 27089 00001486 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 27090                                  
 27091                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 27092                                  
 27093 0000148B B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 27094                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 27095                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27096                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 27097 0000148E F7E1                    	mul	cx
 27098 00001490 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 27099 00001492 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 27100 00001496 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 27101 00001498 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 27102                                  
 27103                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 27104                                  
 27105 0000149B 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 27106 000014A0 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 27107 000014A4 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 27108 000014A6 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 27109 000014A8 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 27110 000014AA 06                      	push	es
 27111 000014AB 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 27112                                  
 27113                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 27114                                  
 27115 000014AC 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 27116 000014B0 FC                      	cld
 27117 000014B1 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 27118                                  
 27119 000014B3 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 27120                                  
 27121                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 27122                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 27123                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 27124                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2
 27125                                  ;  es:bx => first table entry
 27126                                  
 27127                                  buildloop:
 27128                                  	; 11/12/2022
 27129                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free	; mov [es:bp+0],0
 27130                                  	; 25/10/2022
 27131                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp],free
 27132                                  	; 06/07/2023
 27133 000014B7 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al ; 0 ; free
 27134 000014BB 26884601                	mov	[es:bp+intlevel],al	; ax = 0
 27135                                  	;mov	[es:bp+1],al
 27136 000014BF 26894602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],ax
 27137                                  	;mov	[es:bp2],ax
 27138 000014C3 26894604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ax
 27139                                  	;mov	[es:bp+4],ax
 27140 000014C7 031E[0600]              	add	bx,[stacksize]

 27142                                  	;mov	[es:bp+6],bx
 27143 000014CF 26892F                  	mov	[es:bx],bp
 27144 000014D2 83C508                  	add	bp,entrysize ; 8
 27145                                  
 27146 000014D5 E2E0                    	loop	buildloop
 27147                                  
 27148 000014D7 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize ; 8
 27149 000014DA 892E[0E00]              	mov	[lastentry],bp
 27150 000014DE 892E[1000]              	mov	[nextentry],bp
 27151                                  
 27152 000014E2 1E                      	push	ds
 27153                                  	;mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 27154                                  	; 05/09/2023

 27157 000014E7 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?

 27159 000014ED 7504                    	jne	short skip_disablenmis
 27160

 27163

 27891                                  new_init_loop:
 27892                                  	;;; 13/04/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 27893 0000164F 2E803E[6E03]02          	cmp	byte [cs:dosdata_umb],2
 27894                                  				; is DOSDATA=UMB done ? (DOSDATA is in UMB)
 27895 00001655 7510                    	jne	short new_init_loop_1st
 27896 00001657 1E                      	push	ds		; restore original/previous interrupt handler
 27897                                  				; (from int19old?? field in BIOSDATA)
 27898                                  	;mov	ax,70h
 27899 00001658 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 27900 0000165B 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 27901 0000165D C505                    	lds	ax,[di]		; restore original Int ?? handler addr from int19old?? field
 27902 0000165F 268904                  	mov	[es:si],ax	; copy the original int handler addr to its int vector addr
 27903 00001662 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 27904 00001666 1F                      	pop	ds
 27905                                  new_init_loop_1st: 
 27906                                  	;;;
 27907                                  
 27908                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 27909                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 27910                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 27911                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 27912                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 27913                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 27914                                  
 27915                                  ; 13/04/2024
 27916                                  %if 0
 27917                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 27918                                  	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 27919                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 27920                                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 27921                                  
 27922                                  	push	ds
 27923                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 27924                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 27925                                  	; 21/10/2022
 27926                                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 27927                                  	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 27928                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 27929                                  	mov	[di],ax
 27930                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 27931                                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 27932                                  	pop	ds
 27933                                  %else
 27934                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27935 00001667 1E                      	push	ds
 27936 00001668 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 27937 0000166C 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 27938 0000166F 50                      	push	ax
 27939 00001670 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 27940 00001673 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 27941 00001675 50                      	push	ax
 27942 00001676 B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 27943 00001679 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 27944 0000167B 58                      	pop	ax			;int 19 handler
 27945 0000167C 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 27946 0000167E 58                      	pop	ax
 27947 0000167F 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 27948 00001682 1F                      	pop	ds
 27949                                  %endif
 27950 00001683 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 27951 00001686 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 27952 0000168A C3                      	retn

 28236                                  			  		; Note: If unit count > 1,bx points to a BPB in the BPB array,
 28237                                  			  		; the array address is in [bpb_addr] (*)

 28260                                  			  	; DS:SI -> BPB (BIOS Parameter Block)

 28275 0000185D C3                      	retn
 28276                                  
 28277                                  _iblk_1:

 28279 0000185F 2EC506[3924]            	lds	ax,[cs:DevEntry]

 28284 0000186F FEC6                    	inc	dh			; increment unit number

 28287                                  					; (in the BPB array) (*) -add bx,2-

 28292                                  _linkit:

 28325                                  
 28326                                  ; 08/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0

 28329                                  ;***	MagicPostload -- called to clean up and make sure Magic is final placed
 28330                                  
 28331                                  MagicPostload:
 28332                                  	; 13/04/3024
 28333                                  	; ds = cs

 28339 000018C5 B8114A                  	mov	ax,4A11h		; multMagicdrv
 28340                                  					; DBLSPACE.BIN - GET RELOCATION SIZE
 28341 000018C8 CD2F                    	int	2Fh			; get paragraphs into ax
 28342 000018CA 40                      	inc	ax			; extra 2 paragraphs for the stub
 28343 000018CB 40                      	inc	ax			; ((tiny_stub_end-tiny_stub_start)+15)/16
 28344                                  					; (18+15)/16 = 2

 28348                                  	;				; arena header can be set

 28356                                  
 28357 000018DE E8112F                  	call	round			; normalize memhi:memlo
 28358 000018E1 E8811C                  	call	InitDevLoad		; set up sub-arena,DevLoadAddr,
 28359                                  			  		; DevLoadEnd,and DevEntry
 28360                                  					; gets arena name from bpb_addr
 28361                                  	; 13/04/2024
 28362                                  	; ds = cs
 28363                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevLoadAddr]	; (**) (InitDevload sets this)
 28364 000018E4 8E06[3524]              	mov	es,[DevLoadAddr]
 28365                                  
 28366                                  ;	First, move a little header in place so that this looks
 28367                                  ;	to the mem command like a legitimate driver load. Otherwise,
 28368                                  ;	it will display garbage for the device name
 28369                                  
 28370 000018E8 31FF                    	xor	di,di			; move a little header in place
 28371                                  					; so that this looks to the mem command
 28372                                  					; like a legitimate driver load
 28373 000018EA BE[C816]                	mov	si,tiny_stub_start
 28374                                  	;mov	cx,18			; (tiny_stub_end-tiny_stub_start)
 28375 000018ED B91200                  	mov	cx,tiny_stub_end-tiny_stub_start
 28376 000018F0 F3A4                    	rep movsb			; move it!
 28377 000018F2 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; advance es appropriately
 28378 000018F4 40                      	inc	ax			; add ax,((tiny_stub_end-tiny_stub_start)+15)/16
 28379 000018F5 40                      	inc	ax
 28380 000018F6 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 28381 000018F8 BBFEFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFEh ; -2		; final placement!
 28382 000018FB B8114A                  	mov	ax,4A11h		; multMagicdrv
 28383 000018FE CD2F                    	int	2Fh			; DBLSPACE.BIN - RELOCATE
 28384                                  					; es = segment to which to relocate DBLSPACE.BIN
 28385                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadAddr] ; (**)
 28386                                  	;add	ax,[cs:DevSize]		; calculate seg after DD load
 28387                                  	;mov	[cs:DevBrkAddr+2],ax	; save as ending address!
 28388                                  	;mov	word [cs:DevBrkAddr],0

 28390                                  	; ds = cs
 28391 00001900 A1[3524]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadAddr]
 28392 00001903 0306[3324]              	add	ax,[DevSize]
 28393 00001907 A3[3F24]                	mov	[DevBrkAddr+2],ax
 28394 0000190A C706[3D24]0000          	mov	word [DevBrkAddr],0
 28395                                  
 28396 00001910 E8F31D                  	call	DevSetBreak		; go ahead and alloc mem for device
 28397                                  	;call	DevBreak
 28398                                  ;no_magic:
 28399                                  	;retn
 28400                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28401 00001913 E9121E                  	jmp	DevBreak
 28402                                  
 28403                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E ==================================
 28404                                  
 28405                                  ; 08/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28406                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:1C08h)
 28407                                  
 28408                                  ;***	MagicSetCdss -- disable CDSs for still unmounted DblSpace drives
 28409                                  ;
 28410                                  ;	entry:
 28411                                  ;	   CDSs are now persistent and in their final place
 28412                                  
 28413                                  MagicSetCdss:
 28414                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28415                                  	; ds = cs
 28416 00001916 E83D00                  	call	get_dblspace_version	; is it there?
 28417 00001919 753A                    	jnz	short magic_set_exit	; done if not
 28418                                  					; cl = first DblSpace drive in ASCII
 28419                                  					; ch = number of DblSpace drive letters
 28420 0000191B 2EC536[6D02]            	lds	si,[cs:DOSINFO]		; point to DOS data area (SysInitVars)
 28421 00001920 C57416                  	lds	si,[si+16h]		; lds si,[si+SYSI_CDS] ; fetch CDSs
 28422 00001923 B458                    	mov	ah,88			; curdirLen
 28423 00001925 80E941                  	sub	cl,'A'			; make it zero based.
 28424 00001928 88C8                    	mov	al,cl			; get first DblSpace drive letter
 28425 0000192A F6E4                    	mul	ah			; find first DblSpace CDS
 28426 0000192C 01C6                    	add	si,ax			; cds pointer
 28427 0000192E 88CA                    	mov	dl,cl			; save for drive testing loop
 28428 00001930 88E9                    	mov	cl,ch			; get DblSpace drive count into cx
 28429 00001932 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 28430                                  
 28431                                  ;	We know cx > 0, or else the driver wouldn't have stayed resident
 28432                                  
 28433                                  magic_set_cdss_1:
 28434 00001934 51                      	push	cx
 28435 00001935 52                      	push	dx
 28436 00001936 1E                      	push	ds
 28437 00001937 56                      	push	si
 28438 00001938 B8114A                  	mov	ax,4A11h		; multMagicdrv
 28439 0000193B BB0100                  	mov	bx,1			; MD_DRIVE_MAP ; inquire drive map
 28440 0000193E CD2F                    	int	2Fh			; DBLSPACE.BIN - "GetDriveMapping"
 28441                                  					; see if this is an unused DblSpace drive
 28442 00001940 5E                      	pop	si
 28443 00001941 1F                      	pop	ds
 28444 00001942 5A                      	pop	dx
 28445 00001943 59                      	pop	cx
 28446 00001944 38DA                    	cmp	dl,bl			; if mapped to itself,it is vacant
 28447 00001946 7504                    	jnz	short magic_set_cdss_2	; skip if used
 28448 00001948 806444BF                	and	byte [si+44h],0BFh 	; Retro DOS v5.0 ; 08/04/2024
 28449                                  	;and	word [si+43h],0BFFFh
 28450                                  					; reset the bit in flags (curdir_inuse bit)
 28451                                  					; [si+curdir_list.cdir_flags],~curdir_inuse ; word
 28452                                  					; (.. [si+1+curdir_list.cdir_flags],0BFh ; byte)
 28453                                  magic_set_cdss_2:
 28454 0000194C 83C658                  	add	si,88			; curdirLen
 28455 0000194F FEC2                    	inc	dl			; next drive
 28456 00001951 E2E1                    	loop	magic_set_cdss_1
 28457                                  	; 13/04/2024
 28458 00001953 0E                      	push	cs
 28459 00001954 1F                      	pop	ds
 28460                                  magic_set_exit:
 28461 00001955 C3                      	retn
 28462                                  
 28463                                  ; =============== S U B R O U T I N E ==================================
 28464                                  
 28465                                  ; 08/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 28466                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:1C47h)
 28467                                  
 28468                                  get_dblspace_version:
 28469 00001956 B8114A                  	mov	ax,4A11h 	; multMagicdrv
 28470                                  				; DBLSPACE.BIN - "GetVersion" - INSTALLATION CHECK
 28471                                  			 	; (BX = 0)
 28472 00001959 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx	 	; MD_VERSION = 0
 28473 0000195B CD2F                    	int	2Fh	 	; Return:
 28474                                  			 	;  AX = 0000h (successful)
 28475                                  			 	;  BX = 444Dh ("DM")
 28476                                  			 	;  CL = first drive letter used by DBLSPACE (41h = A:)
 28477                                  			 	;  CH = number of drive letters used by DBLSPACE
 28478                                  			 	;  DX = internal DBLSPACE.BIN version number (bits 14-0)
 28479                                  			 	;  bit 15 set if DBLSPACE.BIN has not yet been relocated
 28480                                  			 	;  to final position in memory (i.e. DBLSPACE.SYS /MOVE)
 28481 0000195D 09C0                    	or	ax,ax	 	; ax = 0 (successful,zf=1)
 28482 0000195F C3                      	retn
