 34402                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34403                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 34404                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 34405                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 34406                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 34407                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 34408                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 34409                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 34410                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34411                                  
 34412                                  ;**************************************************************************
 34413                                  ;									  *
 34414                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 34415                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 34416                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 34417                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 34418                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 34419                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 34420                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 34421                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 34422                                  ; input :								  *
 34423                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 34424                                  ; output:								  *
 34425                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 34426                                  ;									  *
 34427                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 34428                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 34429                                  ; logic:								  *
 34430                                  ; {									  *
 34431                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 34432                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 34433                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 34434                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 34435                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 34436                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 34437                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 34438                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 34439                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 34440                                  ;	     }								  *
 34441                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 34442                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 34443                                  ;	};								  *
 34444                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 34445                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 34446                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 34447                                  ; };									  *
 34448                                  ;**************************************************************************

 35261                                  sysinit_parse:
 35262                                  
 35263                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35264                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 35265                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 35266                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 35267                                  ;
 35268                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 35269                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 35270                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 35271                                  ;	*** after each call.
 35272                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 35273                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 35274                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 35275                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 35276                                  ;	 procedure.
 35277                                  ;	ax - exit code
 35278                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 35279                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 35280                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 35281                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 35282                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35283                                  
 35284                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35285                                  	; (SYSINIT:2D78h)

 35301

 35304                                  
 35305                                  	; 09/09/2023

 35318

 35630                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 35631                                  ;
 35632                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 35633                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 35634                                  ;
 35635                                  ;	Output : none
 35636                                  ;
 35637                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 35638                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 35639                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 35640                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 35641                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h

 35650                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 35651 00002F0F E84200                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 35652 00002F12 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 35653                                  	; 13/05/2019
 35654                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 35655                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 35656                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 35657                                  	; 11/12/2022

 35659 00002F14 803E[5124]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 35660 00002F19 74F0                    	je	short limx

 35662                                  lim_set:
 35663                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)

 35671                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35672                                  ;
 35673                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 35674                                  ;
 35675                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 35676                                  ;	Output : none
 35677                                  ;
 35678                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 35679                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 35680                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 35681                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 35682                                  ;
 35683                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35684                                  
 35685                                  	; 01/11/2022
 35686                                  SetInt12Mem:
 35687 00002F1E 1E                      	push	ds
 35688 00002F1F BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 35689 00002F22 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 35690 00002F24 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 35691                                  	;mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 35692 00002F28 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 35693 00002F2A D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 35694 00002F2C A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 35695                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 35696 00002F2F 1F                      	pop	ds
 35697                                  	; 14/04/2024
 35698                                  	; ds = cs
 35699 00002F30 891E[5524]              	mov	[OldInt12Mem],bx
 35700 00002F34 C606[5424]FF            	mov	byte [Int12Lied],0FFh
 35701                                  ;limx:
 35702 00002F39 C3                      	retn
 35703                                  
 35704                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35705                                  ;
 35706                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 35707                                  ;
 35708                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 35709                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 35710                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 35711                                  ;
 35712                                  ;	Output : none
 35713                                  ;

 35715                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 35716                                  ;
 35717                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35718                                  
 35719                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 35720                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35721                                  	; ds = cs
 35722 00002F3A 803E[5424]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 35723                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 35724                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 35725                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 35726 00002F3F 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 35727                                  	; 18/12/2022
 35728 00002F41 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 35729 00002F44 8826[5424]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 35730                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 35731                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 35732 00002F48 1E                      	push	ds
 35733                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 35734 00002F49 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 35735 00002F4B 2EA1[5524]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 35736 00002F4F A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 35737 00002F52 1F                      	pop	ds
 35738                                  timx:
 35739 00002F53 C3                      	retn

 35791                                  
 35792                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35793                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 35794                                  
 35795                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 35796                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 35797                                  
 35798                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 35799                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 35800                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 35801                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35802                                  
 35803                                  ;******************************************************************************
 35804                                  ;
 35805                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 35806                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 35807                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 35808                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 35809                                  ;
 35810                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 35811                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 35812                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 35813                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 35814                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 35815                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 35816                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 35817                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 35818                                  ; available during the load.
 35819                                  ;
 35820                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 35821                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 35822                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 35823                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 35824                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 35825                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 35826                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 35827                                  ;
 35828                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 35829                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 35830                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 35831                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 35832                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 35833                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 35834                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 35835                                  ;
 35836                                  ;******************************************************************************
 35837                                  
 35838                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 35839                                  
 35840                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 35841                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 35842                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 35843                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 35844                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 35845                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 35846                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 35847                                  
 35848                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 35849                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 35850                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 35851                                  
 35852                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35853                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 35854                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35855                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 35856                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 35857                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 35858                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 35859                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35860                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 35861                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 35862                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35863                                  
 35864                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35865                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)

 35868                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35869                                  	; ds = cs
 35870                                  
 35871                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 35872                                  	; 03/01/2023
 35873                                  	;push	ax
 35874                                  	;push	cx
 35875                                  	;push	di
 35876 00002F7E 06                      	push	es
 35877                                  
 35878                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 35879 00002F7F 0E                      	push	cs
 35880 00002F80 07                      	pop	es
 35881                                  
 35882 00002F81 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 35883                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 35884                                  	;mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called

 35887                                  	;				;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB

 35889

 35922                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35923                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 35924                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35925                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 35926                                  ; EXIT    : None
 35927                                  ; ERROR   : None
 35928                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 35929                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35930                                  
 35931                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35932                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 35933                                  FixMem:
 35934                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35935                                  	;push	ax
 35936                                  	;push	bx
 35937                                  	;push	cx
 35938                                  	;push	dx
 35939 00002FA6 06                      	push	es
 35940                                  
 35941 00002FA7 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 35942                                  
 35943 00002FAA E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 35944 00002FAD 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 35945                                  
 35946 00002FAF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 35947                                  
 35948                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 35949                                  
 35950 00002FB1 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 35951 00002FB3 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 35952 00002FB5 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 35953                                  
 35954                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35955                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 35956                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 35957                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35958                                  
 35959 00002FB6 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 35960 00002FBA 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 35961 00002FBF 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 35962 00002FC1 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 35963                                  
 35964                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 35965                                  
 35966 00002FC3 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 35967 00002FC8 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 35968 00002FCA 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 35969                                  
 35970 00002FCE 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 35971                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 35972                                  	; 11/07/2023
 35973 00002FD3 43                      	inc	bx
 35974 00002FD4 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 35975                                  
 35976                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 35977                                  
 35978 00002FD9 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 35979 00002FDB 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 35980                                  
 35981 00002FE0 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 35982 00002FE2 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 35983 00002FE7 43                      	inc	bx
 35984 00002FE8 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 35985                                  
 35986                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 35987 00002FEA 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 35988 00002FEC 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 35989                                  fmX:	
 35990 00002FEE E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 35991                                  
 35992 00002FF1 07                      	pop	es
 35993                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35994                                  	;pop	dx
 35995                                  	;pop	cx
 35996                                  	;pop	bx
 35997                                  	;pop	ax
 35998                                  
 35999 00002FF2 C3                      	retn
 36000                                  
 36001                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36002                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 36003                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36004                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 36005                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 36006                                  ; ERROR:    None
 36007                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 36008                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36009                                  
 36010                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36011                                  fm_link:
 36012 00002FF3 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 36013 00002FF6 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 36014                                  
 36015                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 36016                                  	;
 36017                                  	;push	es
 36018                                  	;push	cs
 36019                                  	;pop	es
 36020                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 36021                                  	;pop	es
 36022                                  	
 36023                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36024                                  	; ds = cs
 36025                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 36026 00002FF8 A2[3024]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 36027                                  
 36028 00002FFB B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 36029 00002FFE BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 36030 00003001 CD21                    	int	21h
 36031 00003003 C3                      	retn
 36032                                  
 36033                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36034                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 36035                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36036                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 36037                                  ; EXIT:     None
 36038                                  ; ERROR:    None
 36039                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 36040                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36041

 36043                                  fm_unlink:
 36044 00003004 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 36045                                  	
 36046                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 36047                                  	;
 36048                                  	;push	ds
 36049                                  	;push	cs
 36050                                  	;pop	ds
 36051                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 36052                                  	;pop	ds
 36053                                  	
 36054                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36055                                  	; ds = cs
 36056                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 36057 00003006 8A1E[3024]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 36058                                  
 36059 0000300A B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 36060 0000300D CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 36061 0000300F C3                      	retn

 36065                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36066                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 36067                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 36068                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36069                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 36070                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 36071                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 36072                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 36073                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36074                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 36075                                  ;
 36076                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 36077                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 36078                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 36079                                  ;
 36080                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 36081                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 36082                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 36083                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 36084                                  ;
 36085                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 36086                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 36087                                  ;
 36088                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36089                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 36090                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 36091                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 36092                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 36093                                  ;     lh
 36094                                  ;     /l
 36095                                  ;     1
 36096                                  ;     1000
 36097                                  ;     2
 36098                                  ;     print
 36099                                  ;     /d
 36100                                  ;     :lpt2
 36101                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 36102                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 36103                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 36104                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 36105                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 36106                                  ; for:
 36107                                  ;    Each /L
 36108                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 36109                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 36110                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 36111                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 36112                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 36113                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36114                                  
 36115                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36116                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 36117                                  
 36118                                  ParseVar:
 36119                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 36120                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36121                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 36122 00003010 1E                      	push	ds
 36123 00003011 06                      	push	es
 36124                                  
 36125 00003012 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 36126 00003013 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 36127 00003014 FC                      	cld
 36128                                  
 36129                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 36130                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 36131                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 36132                                  
 36133 00003015 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 36134 00003016 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 36135 00003019 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 36136                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 36137 0000301B 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 36138 0000301D 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 36139                                  
 36140 0000301F 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 36141 00003020 F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 36142 00003021 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 36143                                  
 36144 00003023 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 36145                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 36146 00003024 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 36147                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 36148 00003026 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 36149 00003028 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 36150                                  
 36151                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 36152 0000302A 2EFE06[3224]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 36153                                  
 36154                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 36155                                  	;
 36156                                  	;push	es
 36157                                  	;push	cs
 36158                                  	;pop	es
 36159                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 36160                                  	;pop	es
 36161                                  
 36162 0000302F 2EC606[FC23]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 36163                                  
 36164 00003035 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 36165                                  
 36166                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 36167 00003037 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 36168 00003039 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 36169                                  
 36170                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 36171 0000303B 2EFE06[3224]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 36172                                  
 36173 00003040 E80E00                  	call	parseL
 36174 00003043 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 36175                                  
 36176 00003045 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 36177 00003046 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 36178                                  
 36179                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 36180 00003048 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 36181 0000304B 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 36182 0000304C 4E                      	dec	si
 36183 0000304D F9                      	stc
 36184                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 36185 0000304E 07                      	pop	es
 36186 0000304F 1F                      	pop	ds
 36187                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36188                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 36189 00003050 C3                      	retn
 36190                                  
 36191                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36192                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 36193                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36194                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 36195                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 36196                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 36197                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 36198                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36199                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 36200                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 36201                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 36202                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 36203                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36204                                  
 36205                                  parseL:
 36206 00003051 AC                      	lodsb
 36207 00003052 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 36208 00003054 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 36209                                  
 36210                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 36211                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 36212                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 36213                                  
 36214 00003056 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 36215 00003059 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 36216 0000305B E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 36217                                  
 36218 0000305E 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 36219 00003060 E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 36220 00003063 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 36221                                  
 36222                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 36223 00003065 2EFE06[3224]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36224                                  
 36225 0000306A AC                      	lodsb
 36226 0000306B 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 36227 0000306D 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 36228                                  
 36229 0000306F E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 36230 00003072 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 36231                                  
 36232 00003074 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 36233 00003077 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 36234                                  
 36235                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 36236 00003079 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 36237 0000307B 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 36238                                  
 36239 0000307D 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 36240 0000307F 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 36241                                  
 36242                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 36243                                  
 36244 00003081 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 36245 00003084 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 36246                                  
 36247 00003086 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 36248                                  
 36249 00003089 E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 36250                                  
 36251                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 36252 0000308C 2EFE06[3224]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36253                                  
 36254 00003091 AC                      	lodsb
 36255 00003092 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 36256 00003094 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 36257                                  
 36258 00003096 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 36259 00003099 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 36260                                  
 36261 0000309B E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 36262 0000309E 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 36263                                  
 36264                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 36265 000030A0 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 36266 000030A2 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 36267                                  plE1:	
 36268                                  	;mov	ax,1
 36269 000030A4 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 36270 000030A7 4E                      	dec	si
 36271 000030A8 F9                      	stc
 36272 000030A9 C3                      	retn
 36273                                  
 36274                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 36275 000030AA B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 36276                                  	; 12/12/2022
 36277                                  	; cf=1
 36278                                  	;stc
 36279 000030AD C3                      	retn
 36280                                  plSwX:	
 36281 000030AE 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 36282                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 36283                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 36284                                  	; cf=0
 36285                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 36286 000030AF C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 36287                                  
 36288                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36289                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 36290                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36291                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 36292                                  ; EXIT:     None
 36293                                  ; ERROR:    None
 36294                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 36295                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36296                                  
 36297                                  ;incArgc:

 36299                                  
 36300                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 36301                                  
 36302                                  	;mov	al,[cs:fm_argc]
 36303                                  
 36304                                  	;inc	al		; Increment it,
 36305                                  
 36306                                  	;;putdata fm_argc, al	; And store it right back.
 36307                                  
 36308                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_argc],al
 36309                                  
 36310                                  	;pop	ax
 36311                                  	;retn
 36312                                  
 36313                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36314                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 36315                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36316                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 36317                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 36318                                  ; ERROR:    None
 36319                                  ; USES:     ZF
 36320                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36321                                  
 36322                                  isEOL:
 36323 000030B0 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 36324 000030B2 7406                    	je	short ieX
 36325 000030B4 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 36326 000030B6 7402                    	je	short ieX
 36327 000030B8 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 36328                                  ieX:	
 36329 000030BA C3                      	retn
 36330                                  
 36331                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36332                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 36333                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36334                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 36335                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 36336                                  ; ERROR:    None
 36337                                  ; USES:     ZF
 36338                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36339                                  
 36340                                  isWhite:
 36341 000030BB 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 36342 000030BD 7406                    	je	short iwX
 36343 000030BF 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 36344 000030C1 7402                    	je	short iwX
 36345 000030C3 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 36346                                  iwX:	
 36347 000030C5 C3                      	retn

 36400                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36401                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 36402                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 36403                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 36404                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 36405                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36406                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 36407                                  ; EXIT:     None
 36408                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 36409                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 36410                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36411                                  
 36412                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36413                                  stowUMB:
 36414 000030D9 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 36415 000030DB 7202                    	jb	short su10
 36416 000030DD F9                      	stc
 36417 000030DE C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 36418                                  su10:	
 36419                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36420                                  	;push	bx
 36421                                  	;push	di
 36422                                  	;push	si
 36423                                  	;push	ds
 36424                                  	;push	es
 36425                                  	;push	cs
 36426                                  	;pop	es
 36427                                  	;push	cs
 36428                                  	;pop	ds
 36429                                  
 36430                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36431                                  	; ds <> cs
 36432                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 36433 000030DF 2E803E[FF23]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 36434                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 36435 000030E5 7504                    	jne	short su20
 36436 000030E7 2EA2[FF23]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 36437                                  
 36438                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 36439                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 36440                                  	;jne	short su20
 36441                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 36442                                  su20:	
 36443 000030EB 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 36444 000030ED 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 36445                                  
 36446                                  	;mov	bl,al
 36447                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 36448                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 36449                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36450 000030EF 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 36451 000030F1 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 36452 000030F3 B001                    	mov	al,1
 36453                                  
 36454                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 36455                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36456 000030F5 2E8687[0024]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 36457                                  
 36458                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 36459                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 36460                                  	;
 36461                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 36462                                  	
 36463                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36464 000030FA 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 36465 000030FC F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 36466                                  su30:	
 36467                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36468                                  	;pop	es
 36469                                  	;pop	ds
 36470                                  	;pop	si
 36471                                  	;pop	di
 36472                                  	;pop	bx
 36473 000030FD C3                      	retn

 36476                                  %if 0

 36513                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36514                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 36515                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 36516                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 36517                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 36518                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36519                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 36520                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 36521                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 36522                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 36523                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36524                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 36525                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 36526                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 36527                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36528                                  
 36529                                  gnradix:
 36530 000030FE 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 36531                                  
 36532                                  toDigit:
 36533 00003100 2E833E[FE30]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 36534 00003106 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 36535                                  
 36536                                  toDigit_hex:
 36537 00003108 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 36538 0000310B 7209                    	jb	short td10
 36539 0000310D 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 36540 00003110 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 36541 00003112 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 36542                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 36543 00003115 C3                      	retn
 36544                                  td10:	
 36545 00003116 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 36546 00003119 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 36547 0000311B 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 36548 0000311E 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 36549 00003120 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 36550                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 36551 00003123 C3                      	retn
 36552                                  toDigit_dec:
 36553                                  td20:	
 36554 00003124 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 36555                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 36556 00003127 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 36557 00003129 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 36558 0000312C 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 36559 0000312E 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 36560                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 36561 00003131 C3                      	retn
 36562                                  tdE:	
 36563 00003132 F9                      	stc
 36564                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 36565 00003133 C3                      	retn
 36566                                  
 36567                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36568                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 36569                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36570                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 36571                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 36572                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 36573                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 36574                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36575                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 36576                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 36577                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 36578                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36579                                  
 36580                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 36581                                  
 36582                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36583                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 36584                                  
 36585                                  GetXNum:
 36586                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 36587                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36588                                  	;push	bx
 36589 00003134 51                      	push	cx ; *
 36590                                  	;push	ds
 36591                                  
 36592 00003135 FC                      	cld
 36593 00003136 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 36594 00003138 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 36595 0000313A 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 36596 0000313C 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 36597                                  
 36598 0000313E 2EC706[FE30]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 36599                                  
 36600 00003145 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 36601                                  	;call	toDigit
 36602 00003148 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 36603                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 36604                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36605 0000314B 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 36606                                  
 36607 0000314D 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 36608 0000314F 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 36609 00003151 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 36610 00003155 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 36611 00003158 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 36612 0000315A 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 36613 0000315D 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 36614                                  
 36615                                  gxn10:	
 36616 0000315F 2EC706[FE30]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 36617 00003166 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 36618 00003167 46                      	inc	si
 36619                                  
 36620                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 36621                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 36622                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 36623                                  ;        BX    = 0
 36624                                  ;        CH    = 0
 36625                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 36626                                  
 36627                                  gxn20:	
 36628 00003168 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 36629 0000316B 46                      	inc	si
 36630                                  
 36631 0000316C E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 36632 0000316F 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 36633                                  
 36634 00003171 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 36635 00003174 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 36636                                  
 36637 00003176 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 36638 00003178 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 36639                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 36640                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 36641 0000317A 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 36642                                  gxnE:	
 36643                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 36644 0000317C EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 36645                                  gxnQ:	
 36646 0000317E 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 36647 0000317F F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 36648                                  gxnX:	
 36649                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36650                                  	;pop	ds
 36651 00003180 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 36652                                  	;pop	bx
 36653 00003181 C3                      	retn
 36654                                  
 36655                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36656                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 36657                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36658                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 36659                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 36660                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 36661                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 36662                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36663                                  
 36664                                  mul32:
 36665 00003182 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36666 00003183 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36667 00003185 2EF726[FE30]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36668 0000318A 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 36669                                  
 36670 0000318C 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36671 0000318E 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 36672                                  
 36673 0000318F 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 36674 00003191 2EF726[FE30]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 36675 00003196 87D3                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 36676 00003198 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 36677 0000319A 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 36678 0000319C C3                      	retn
 36679                                  m32E:	
 36680 0000319D 58                      	pop	ax
 36681 0000319E C3                      	retn
 36682                                  
 36683                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36684                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 36685                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36686                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 36687                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 36688                                  ; ERROR:   None
 36689                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 36690                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36691                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 36692                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 36693                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36694                                  
 36695                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36696                                  toPara:
 36697 0000319F 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 36698                                  
 36699 000031A0 B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 36700 000031A2 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 36701 000031A4 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 36702 000031A5 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 36703 000031A7 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 36704 000031A9 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 36705                                  
 36706 000031AB 59                      	pop	cx
 36707 000031AC C3                      	retn

 36709                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36710                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 36711                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36712                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 36713                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 36714                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 36715                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 36716                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36717                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 36718                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 36719                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 36720                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 36721                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 36723                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36724                                  UmbHead:

 36736 000031AF CD21                    	int	21h

 36738 000031B1 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 36739                                  	
 36740                                  	; 01/01/2023

 36744 000031B9 C3                      	retn

 36795                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36796                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 36797                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36798                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 36799                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 36800                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 36801                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 36802                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36803                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 36804                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 36805                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 36806                                  ;      ...
 36807                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 36808                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36809                                  
 36810                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36811                                  AddrToUmb:
 36812                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36813                                  	;push	cx
 36814                                  	;push	dx
 36815 000031CA 06                      	push	es
 36816                                  
 36817 000031CB 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 36818

 36820 000031D0 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 36821                                  
 36822                                  	; 22/07/2023
 36823                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 36824 000031D2 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 36825                                  
 36826                                  	; 22/07/2023
 36827                                  atu10:

 36839

 36863                                  
 36864                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36865                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 36866                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.

 36876                                  atuE:

 36879                                  atuX:

 36881

 36885                                  	;pop	cx

 36888                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36889                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 36890                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 36891                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 36892                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 36893                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------

 36895                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number

 36901                                  convUMB:
 36902 000031FB 2E833E[FE30]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 36903 00003201 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 36904 00003203 E8C4FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 36905                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh

 36911 00003209 48                      	dec	ax
