 39718                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39719                                  ;
 39720                                  ; procedure : LinkFirstUMB
 39721                                  ;
 39722                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39723                                  
 39724                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 39725                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F81h)
 39726                                  LinkFirstUMB:
 39727                                  	; 31/12/2022
 39728                                  	; ds = cs
 39729 0000395E E8CEFF                  	call	umb_allocate
 39730 00003961 72FA                    	jc	short lfu_err  ; ds = cs ; 31/12/2022
 39731                                  
 39732                                  ; bx = segment of allocated UMB
 39733                                  ; dx = size of UMB
 39734                                  
 39735                                  	; 31/12/2022
 39736                                  	; ds = cs
 39737                                  
 39738 00003963 CD12                    	int	12h			; ax = size of memory
 39739 00003965 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 39740 00003967 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl			; ax = size in paragraphs
 39741                                  
 39742 00003969 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			; cx = size in paras
 39743 0000396B 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx			; ax = - size of unused block
 39744                                  
 39745 0000396D F7D8                    	neg	ax
 39746                                  
 39747                                  	;sub	cx,1			; cx = first umb_arena
 39748                                  	; 09/09/2023
 39749 0000396F 49                      	dec	cx
 39750 00003970 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; es = first umb_arena
 39751                                  	
 39752 00003972 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal ; 'M'
 39753 00003978 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; mark as system owned
 39754                                  					
 39755 0000397F 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax	
 39756 00003983 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; 4353h
 39757                                  
 39758                                  ; put in the arena for the first UMB
 39759                                  
 39760 0000398A 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx			; es has first free umb seg
 39761 0000398C 26C60600005A            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 39762 00003992 26C70601000000          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],arena_owner_system ; 0	
 39763                                  					; mark as free 
 39764 00003999 4A                      	dec	dx			; make room for arena
 39765 0000399A 2689160300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],dx	
 39766                                  
 39767                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]
 39768                                  	; 31/12/2022
 39769 0000399F 8E06[6024]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData] ; ds = cs
 39770 000039A3 BF8C00                  	mov	di,UMB_ARENA ; 8Ch
 39771 000039A6 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx		; initialize umb_head in DOS
 39772                                  					;  data segment with the arena
 39773                                  					;  just below Top of Mem
 39774                                  
 39775                                  ; we must now scan the arena chain and update the size of the last arena
 39776                                  
 39777 000039A9 BF2400                  	mov	di,DOS_ARENA ; 24h
 39778 000039AC 268E05                  	mov	es,[es:di]		; es = start arena
 39779 000039AF 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 39780                                  ;scan_next
 39781                                  ; 09/12/2022
 39782                                  scannext:
 39783 000039B1 26803D5A                	cmp	byte [es:di],arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 39784 000039B5 740C                    	je	short got_last
 39785                                  	
 39786 000039B7 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 39787 000039B9 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 39788 000039BE 40                      	inc	ax
 39789 000039BF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 39790                                  	;jmp	short scan_next
 39791                                  	; 09/12/2022
 39792 000039C1 EBEE                    	jmp	short scannext
 39793                                  got_last:
 39794                                  	;sub	word [es:ARENA.SIZE],1
 39795                                  	; 09/09/2023
 39796 000039C3 26FF0E0300              	dec	word [es:ARENA.SIZE]
 39797                                  
 39798 000039C8 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal ; 'M'
 39799                                  	;clc
 39800                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 39801                                  	; 11/12/2022
 39802                                  	; cf=0
 39803                                  	;clc
 39804 000039CE C3                      	retn
 39805                                  
 39806                                  ; 11/12/2022
 39807                                  ;;lfu_err:
 39808                                  ;	;stc
 39809                                  ;	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 39810                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 39811                                  ;	; cf=1
 39812                                  ;	;stc
 39813                                  ;	retn

 39815                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39816                                  ;
 39817                                  ; procedure : ShrinkUMB
 39818                                  ;
 39819                                  ;	Shrinks the current UMB in use, so that the unused portions
 39820                                  ;	of the UMB is given back to the DOS free mem pool
 39821                                  ;
 39822                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39823                                  
 39824                                  ShrinkUMB:
 39825                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39826                                  	; ds = cs
 39827 000039CF 833E[4324]00            	cmp	word [DevUMBAddr],0
 39828                                  	;cmp	word [cs:DevUMBAddr],0
 39829 000039D4 741F                    	je	short su_exit
 39830 000039D6 06                      	push	es
 39831                                  	; 01/01/2023
 39832                                  	;push	bx
 39833                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39834                                  	;mov	bx,[cs:DevUMBFree]
 39835                                  	;sub	bx,[cs:DevUMBAddr]
 39836                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevUMBAddr]
 39837 000039D7 8B1E[4724]              	mov	bx,[DevUMBFree]
 39838 000039DB 2B1E[4324]              	sub	bx,[DevUMBAddr]
 39839 000039DF 8E06[4324]              	mov	es,[DevUMBAddr]
 39840                                  	
 39841 000039E3 B8004A                  	mov	ax,4A00h
 39842 000039E6 CD21                    	int	21h
 39843                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 39844                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 39845                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs
 39846 000039E8 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 39847 000039EA 48                      	dec	ax
 39848 000039EB 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 39849 000039ED 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8
 39850                                  	; 01/01/2023
 39851                                  	;pop	bx
 39852 000039F4 07                      	pop	es
 39853                                  su_exit:
 39854 000039F5 C3                      	retn

 39856                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39857                                  ;
 39858                                  ; procedure : UnlinkUMB
 39859                                  ;
 39860                                  ;	Unlinks the UMBs from the DOS arena chain
 39861                                  ;
 39862                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39863                                  
 39864                                  UnlinkUMB:
 39865                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39866                                  	; ds = cs
 39867 000039F6 1E                      	push	ds
 39868 000039F7 06                      	push	es
 39869                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39870 000039F8 803E[5F24]00            	cmp	byte [FirstUMBLinked],0
 39871                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:FirstUMBLinked],0
 39872 000039FD 7420                    	je	short ulu_x		; nothing to unlink
 39873                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39874 000039FF 8E06[6024]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData]
 39875                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]	; get DOS data seg
 39876 00003A03 268E1E2400              	mov	ds,[es:DOS_ARENA]
 39877 00003A08 268B3E8C00              	mov	di,[es:UMB_ARENA]
 39878                                  ulu_next:
 39879 00003A0D E83BFF                  	call	get_next
 39880 00003A10 720D                    	jc	short ulu_x
 39881 00003A12 39C7                    	cmp	di,ax			; is the next one UMB ?
 39882 00003A14 7404                    	je	short ulu_found
 39883 00003A16 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 39884 00003A18 EBF3                    	jmp	short ulu_next
 39885                                  ulu_found:
 39886                                  	;mov	byte [0],'Z'
 39887 00003A1A C60600005A              	mov     byte [ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 39888                                  ulu_x:
 39889 00003A1F 07                      	pop	es
 39890 00003A20 1F                      	pop	ds
 39891 00003A21 C3                      	retn
 39892                                  
 39893                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 39894                                  ; SYSINIT2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 39895                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 39896                                  ; 14/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39897                                  
 39898                                  ; Multiple configuration block support  Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 39899                                  ;
 39900                                  ; Summary:
 39901                                  ;
 39902                                  ;   The procedure "organize" crunches the in-memory copy of config.sys
 39903                                  ;   into lines delimited by CR/LF (sometimes no CR, but *always* an LF)
 39904                                  ;   with the leading "keyword=" replaced by single character codes (eg, B
 39905                                  ;   for BUFFERS, D for DEVICE, Z for any unrecognized keyword); see comtab
 39906                                  ;   and/or config.inc for the full list.
 39907                                  ;
 39908                                  ;   [blockname] and INCLUDE are the major syntactical additions for multi-
 39909                                  ;   configuration support. blockname is either MENU, which contains one
 39910                                  ;   or more MENUITEM lines, an optional MENUDEFAULT (which includes optional
 39911                                  ;   time-out), or any user-defined keyword, such as NETWORK, CD-ROM, etc.
 39912                                  ;   INCLUDE allows the current block to name another block for inclusion
 39913                                  ;   during the processing phase of CONFIG.SYS. An INCLUDE is only honored
 39914                                  ;   once, precluding nasty infinite-loop scenarios. If blocks are present
 39915                                  ;   without a MENU block, then only lines inside COMMON blocks are processed.
 39916                                  ;
 39917                                  ; Example:
 39918                                  ;
 39919                                  ;   [menu]
 39920                                  ;   menuitem=misc,Miscellaneous
 39921                                  ;   menuitem=network,Network Configuration
 39922                                  ;   menudefault=network,15
 39923                                  ;
 39924                                  ;   [network]
 39925                                  ;   include misc
 39926                                  ;   device=foo
 39927                                  ;
 39928                                  ;   [misc]
 39929                                  ;   device=bar
 39930                                  ;   include alternate
 39931                                  ;
 39932                                  ;   [alternate]
 39933                                  ;   device=tar
 39934                                  ;
 39935                                  ;
 39936                                  ;   When the menu is displayed
 39937                                  ;
 39938                                  ;    1. Miscellaneous
 39939                                  ;    2. Network Configuration
 39940                                  ;
 39941                                  ;   #2 is highlighted as the default option, and will be automatically
 39942                                  ;   selected after 15 seconds. It will invoke the following lines in the
 39943                                  ;   following order:
 39944                                  ;
 39945                                  ;       DEVICE=BAR
 39946                                  ;       DEVICE=TAR
 39947                                  ;       DEVICE=FOO
 39948                                  ;
 39949                                  
 39950                                  ;MULTI_CONFIG equ 1
 39951                                  
 39952                                  ; the following depend on the positions of the various letters in switchlist
 39953                                  
 39954                                  switchnum	equ 11111000b ; 0F8h	; which switches require number
 39955                                  
 39956                                  flagec35	equ 00000100b ; 4	; electrically compatible 3.5 inch disk drive
 39957                                  flagdrive	equ 00001000b ; 8 
 39958                                  flagcyln	equ 00010000b ; 16
 39959                                  flagseclim	equ 00100000b ; 32
 39960                                  flagheads	equ 01000000b ; 64
 39961                                  flagff		equ 10000000b ; 128
 39962                                  
 39963                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39964                                  ; 19/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39965                                  
 39966                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3E78h
 39967                                  
 39968                                  ; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 39969                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3054h
 39970                                  
 39971 00003A22 00                      insert_blank:	db 	0

 40108                                  ; procedure : parseline
 40109                                  ;
 40110                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.
 40111                                  ;
 40112                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40113                                  
 40114                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 40115                                  	; (SYSINIT:3EDFh)
 40116                                  
 40117                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 40118                                  	; (SYSINIT:30ACh)
 40119                                  parseline:
 40120                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40121                                  	; ds = cs ; *
 40122                                  
 40123                                  	;push	ds ; *
 40124                                  
 40125                                  	;push	cs ; *
 40126                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 40127                                  
 40128                                  nextswtch:
 40129                                  	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 40130                                  	je	short done_line
 40131                                  	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 40132                                  	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 40133                                  
 40134                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 40135                                  
 40136                                  	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 40137                                  	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 40138                                  	cmp	al,'/'
 40139                                  	je	short getparm
 40140                                  	stc				; mark error invalid-character-in-input
 40141                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 40142                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40143                                  swterr:
 40144                                  	retn
 40145                                  
 40146                                  getparm:
 40147                                  	call	check_switch
 40148                                  	mov	[switches],bx		; save switches read so far
 40149                                  	jc	short swterr
 40150                                  getnext:
 40151                                  	call	getchr
 40152                                  	;jc	short done_line
 40153                                  	;jmp	short nextswtch
 40154                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40155                                  	jnc	short nextswtch
 40156                                  ;swterr:
 40157                                  	;jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 40158                                  
 40159                                  done_line:
 40160                                  	; 12/12/2022
 40161                                  	test	byte [switches],flagdrive ; 8
 40162                                  	;test	word [switches],flagdrive ; 8 ; see if drive specified
 40163                                  	jnz	short okay
 40164                                  	stc				; mark error no-drive-specified
 40165                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 40166                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40167                                  	retn
 40168                                  
 40169                                  okay:
 40170                                  	mov	ax,[switches]
 40171                                  	and	ax,0003h	    ; get flag bits for changeline and non-rem
 40172                                  	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES],ax
 40173                                  	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES],0
 40174                                  	;clc			    ; everything is fine
 40175                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 40176                                  	; 12/12/2022
 40177                                  	; cf=0
 40178                                  	;clc
 40179                                  	;call	setdeviceparameters
 40180                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40181                                  	jmp	setdeviceparameters
 40182                                  ;exitpl:
 40183                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40184                                  	; ds = cs
 40185                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 40186                                  	retn
 40187                                  put_back:
 40188                                  	inc	word [count]		; one more char to scan
 40189                                  	dec	word [chrptr]		; back up over linefeed
 40190                                  	jmp	short done_line
 40191

 40479                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40480                                  ;
 40481                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 40482                                  ;
 40483                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 40484                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 40485                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 40486                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 40487                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 40488                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 40489                                  ;
 40490                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 40491                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 40492                                  ;
 40493                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 40494                                  ;
 40495                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40496                                  
 40497                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40498                                  
 40499                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 40500                                  
 40501                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 40502                                  	; (SYSINIT:3FC4h)
 40503                                  
 40504                                  	; 09/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 40505                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:4236h)
 40506                                  
 40507                                  setdeviceparameters:
 40508                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40509                                  	; ds = cs
 40510

 40512

 40514 00003B49 07                      	pop	es
 40515                                  
 40516 00003B4A 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 40517 00003B4C 8A1E[C04D]              	mov	bl,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]

 40519 00003B53 7506                    	jne	short got_80
 40520

 40522                                  							; 48 tpi=40 cyl
 40523                                  got_80:

 40557 00003B82 A3[D54D]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.HEADS],ax
 40558                                  
 40559                                  heads_not_altered:
 40560                                  
 40561                                  ; set up correct media descriptor byte and sectors/cluster
 40562                                  ;   sectors/cluster is always 2 except for any one sided disk or 1.44M
 40563                                  
 40564                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+9],2
 40565                                  	; 02/11/2022
 40566                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],2
 40567                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40568 00003B85 B80200                  	mov	ax,2	
 40569 00003B88 A2[C84D]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 2
 40570                                  
 40571 00003B8B B3F0                    	mov	bl,0F0h			; get default mediabyte
 40572                                  
 40573                                  ;	preload the mediadescriptor from the bpb into bh for convenient access
 40574                                  
 40575                                  	;mov	bh,[deviceparameters+17]
 40576                                  	; 02/11/2022
 40577 00003B8D 8A3E[D04D]              	mov	bh,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 40578                                  	
 40579                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40580                                  	; ax = 2
 40581 00003B91 3906[D54D]              	cmp	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.HEADS],ax ; >2 heads?
 40582                                  	;cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.HEADS],2 ; >2 heads?
 40583 00003B95 773C                    	ja	short got_correct_mediad ; just use default if heads>2
 40584                                  
 40585 00003B97 7524                    	jne	short only_one_head	; one head, do one head stuff
 40586                                  
 40587                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 40588                                  
 40589 00003B99 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 40590                                  
 40591                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 40592                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 40593                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 40594                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 40595                                  
 40596                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 40597                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 40598                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 40599                                  
 40600 00003B9B 833E[D34D]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 40601 00003BA0 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 40602 00003BA2 833E[C34D]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 40603 00003BA7 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 40604                                  
 40605                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 40606                                  
 40607 00003BA9 EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 40608                                  
 40609                                  ;	check for 320K
 40610                                  
 40611                                  not_144m:
 40612 00003BAB 833E[C34D]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 40613 00003BB0 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 40614 00003BB2 833E[D34D]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 40615 00003BB7 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 40616                                  
 40617 00003BB9 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh
 40618 00003BBB EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediad
 40619                                  
 40620                                  only_one_head:
 40621                                  
 40622                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 40623                                  
 40624 00003BBD 803E[C04D]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 40625 00003BC2 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 40626                                  
 40627                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 40628                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 40629                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 40630                                  
 40631 00003BC4 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 40632 00003BC6 833E[D34D]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 40633                                  	; 12/12/2022
 40634 00003BCB 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 40635                                  
 40636 00003BCD B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 40637                                  
 40638                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 40639                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 40640                                  
 40641                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 40642                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40643                                  	; ax = 2
 40644 00003BCF 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 40645 00003BD0 A2[C84D]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 40646                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 40647                                  
 40648                                  got_correct_mediad:
 40649 00003BD3 881E[D04D]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl
 40650                                  
 40651                                  ;	 Calculate the correct number of Total Sectors on medium
 40652                                  
 40653 00003BD7 A1[C34D]                	mov	ax,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 40654 00003BDA F726[D54D]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.HEADS]
 40655 00003BDE F726[D34D]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 40656 00003BE2 A3[CE4D]                	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.TOTALSECTORS],ax
 40657 00003BE5 F8                      	clc				; we currently return no errors
 40658                                  
 40659 00003BE6 C3                      	retn
 40660                                  
 40661                                  ;	M047 -- end rewritten routine

 41206                                  ;
 41207                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 41208                                  ;
 41209                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 41210                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 41211                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 41212                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 41213                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 41214                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 41215                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 41216                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 41217                                  ;
 41218                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41219                                  
 41220                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 41221                                  	; (SYSINIT:428Dh)
 41222                                  
 41223                                  skip_comment:
 41224 00003DEF E3EA                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 41225                                  
 41226                                  	; 03/01/2023
 41227                                  	; ds = cs	
 41228                                  
 41229 00003DF1 803E[5003]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 41230                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 41231 00003DF6 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 41232                                  
 41233 00003DF8 803E[5103]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 41234                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 41235 00003DFD 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 41236                                  
 41237 00003DFF 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 41238                                  	
 41239 00003E02 3806[5203]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 41240                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 41241 00003E06 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 41242                                  
 41243 00003E08 803E[5103]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 41244                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 41245 00003E0D 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 41246                                  
 41247 00003E0F 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 41248                                  	
 41249 00003E13 3806[5303]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 41250                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 41251 00003E17 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 41252                                  skip_cmmt:
 41253 00003E19 E3C0                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 41254 00003E1B 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 41255 00003E1E 46                      	inc	si
 41256 00003E1F 49                      	dec	cx
 41257 00003E20 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 41258 00003E22 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 41259                                  no_commt:

 41262                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 41263                                  ; (SYSINIT:42C8h)

 41266                                  ;%if 0

 41268                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 41269                                  
 41270                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41271                                  ;
 41272                                  ;   kbd_read: wait for keystroke
 41273                                  ;
 41274                                  ;   INPUT
 41275                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 41276                                  ;
 41277                                  ;   OUTPUT
 41278                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 41279                                  ;
 41280                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 41281                                  ;       All
 41282                                  ;
 41283                                  ;   HISTORY
 41284                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 41285                                  ;
 41286                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41287                                  
 41288                                  kbd_read:
 41289 00003E25 F606[814C]02                    test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 41290 00003E2A 7520                            jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 41291                                  
 41292 00003E2C 1E                              push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 41293 00003E2D 29C0                            sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 41294 00003E2F 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 41295                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 41296                                  kbd_loop:
 41297 00003E31 B401                            mov     ah,1            ;
 41298 00003E33 CD16                            int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 41299 00003E35 7514                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 41300 00003E37 B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 41301 00003E39 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 41302 00003E3B A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 41303 00003E3D 750C                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 41304 00003E3F A16C04                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 41305                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 41306                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41307 00003E42 2E2B06[8C03]            	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 41308                                  
 41309 00003E47 3C25                    	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?  ; (2 seconds)
 41310 00003E49 72E6                            jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 41311                                  kbd_loopdone:
 41312 00003E4B 1F                              pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 41313                                  kbd_nodelay:
 41314 00003E4C 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 41315 00003E4E B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 41316 00003E50 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 41317 00003E52 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 41318 00003E54 7407                            jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 41319 00003E56 43                              inc     bx              ; yes
 41320 00003E57 43                              inc     bx
 41321                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 41322 00003E58 800E[854C]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 41323                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 41324 00003E5D B401                            mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 41325 00003E5F CD16                            int     16h             ;
 41326 00003E61 743E                            jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 41327 00003E63 08C0                            or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 41328 00003E65 753A                            jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 41329                                  
 41330                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 41331 00003E67 80FC62                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 41332 00003E6A 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 41333                                  	
 41334 00003E6C 80FC3F                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 41335 00003E6F 750D                            jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 41336                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 41337 00003E71 BA[FC51]                        mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 41338 00003E74 E8DD0B                          call    print
 41339                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 41340 00003E77 800E[854C]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4 
 41341 00003E7C EB16                            jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 41342                                  kbd_notf5:
 41343                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 41344 00003E7E 80FC65                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 41345 00003E81 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 41346                                  
 41347 00003E83 80FC42                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 41348 00003E86 7523                            jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 41349                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 41350 00003E88 BA[3A52]                        mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 41351 00003E8B E8C60B                          call    print           ;
 41352 00003E8E B301                            mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 41353 00003E90 881E[854C]                      mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 41354                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 41355 00003E94 B400                            mov     ah,0            ;
 41356 00003E96 CD16                            int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 41357 00003E98 C606[8B4C]FF                    mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 41358 00003E9D 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ;
 41359 00003E9F 7405                            jz	short kbd_clean	;
 41360                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 41361 00003EA1 80FB02                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 41362 00003EA4 7205                            jb	short kbd_exit	;
 41363                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 41364 00003EA6 E86E08                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 41365 00003EA9 F9                              stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 41366 00003EAA C3                              retn			;
 41367                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 41368 00003EAB F8                              clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 41369 00003EAC C3                              retn			;
 41370                                  
 41371                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41372                                  ;
 41373                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 41374                                  ;
 41375                                  ;   INPUT
 41376                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 41377                                  ;
 41378                                  ;   OUTPUT
 41379                                  ;       None
 41380                                  ;
 41381                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 41382                                  ;       None
 41383                                  ;
 41384                                  ;   HISTORY
 41385                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 41386                                  ;
 41387                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41388                                  
 41389                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 41390                                  
 41391                                  set_numlock:
 41392                                          ; 04/01/2023
 41393                                  	;push	ax
 41394 00003EAD 1E                              push    ds
 41395 00003EAE 29C0                            sub     ax,ax
 41396 00003EB0 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax
 41397 00003EB2 268B04                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 41398 00003EB5 2E3B06[C451]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 41399 00003EBA 7507                            jne	short not_off	; no
 41400 00003EBC 80261704DF                      and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 41401 00003EC1 EB0D                            jmp     short set_done
 41402                                  not_off:
 41403 00003EC3 2E3B06[C251]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 41404 00003EC8 F9                              stc
 41405 00003EC9 7505                            jne	short set_done	; no
 41406 00003ECB 800E170420                      or      byte [0417h],20h
 41407                                  set_done:
 41408 00003ED0 1F                              pop     ds
 41409                                  	; 04/01/2023
 41410                                  	;pop	ax
 41411 00003ED1 C3                              retn
 41412                                  
 41413                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 41414                                  
 41415                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41416                                  ;
 41417                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 41418                                  ;
 41419                                  ;   INPUT
 41420                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 41421                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 41422                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 41423                                  ;
 41424                                  ;   OUTPUT
 41425                                  ;       Same as above; the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 41426                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 41427                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 41428                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 41429                                  ;
 41430                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 41431                                  ;       All
 41432                                  ;
 41433                                  ;   NOTES
 41434                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 41435                                  ;
 41436                                  ;   HISTORY
 41437                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 41438                                  ;
 41439                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 41440                                  
 41441                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 41442                                  	; (SYSINIT:4378h)
 41443                                  
 41444                                  menu_check:
 41445                                  
 41446                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present; if so, then
 41447                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 41448                                  
 41449 00003ED2 51                              push    cx              ;
 41450 00003ED3 56                              push    si              ;
 41451 00003ED4 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 41452                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 41453 00003ED6 E83507                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 41454 00003ED9 724C                            jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 41455 00003EDB 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; '['
 41456 00003EDD 7503                            jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 41457 00003EDF 43                              inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 41458 00003EE0 EB40                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 41459                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 41460 00003EE2 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 41461 00003EE4 750E                            jne	short swchk_next2 ;
 41462 00003EE6 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 41463 00003EE8 7538                            jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 41464 00003EEA E8C0FF                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 41465 00003EED 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 41466 00003EF2 EB2E                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 41467                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 41468 00003EF4 3C31                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 41469 00003EF6 752A                            jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 41470                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 41471 00003EF8 E81307                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 41472                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 41473 00003EFB 3C0A                            cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 41474 00003EFD 7423                            je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 41475 00003EFF 3C2F                            cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 41476 00003F01 75F5                            jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 41477 00003F03 E80807                          call    get_char        ;
 41478 00003F06 24DF                            and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 41479 00003F08 3A06[6323]                      cmp     al,[swit_n+1]	; 'N'
 41480 00003F0C 7507                            jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 41481 00003F0E 800E[814C]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 41482 00003F13 EBE3                            jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 41483                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 41484 00003F15 3A06[6F23]                      cmp     al,[swit_f+1]	; 'F'
 41485 00003F19 75E0                            jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 41486 00003F1B 800E[814C]02                    or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 41487 00003F20 EBD6                            jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 41488                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 41489 00003F22 E8C306                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 41490 00003F25 EBAF                            jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 41491                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 41492 00003F27 5E                              pop     si              ;
 41493 00003F28 59                              pop     cx              ;
 41494                                  
 41495                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 41496                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 41497                                  
 41498 00003F29 F606[814C]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 41499 00003F2E 7508                            jnz	short menu_search
 41500                                  ;
 41501                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 41502                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 41503                                  ;
 41504 00003F30 E8F2FE                          call    kbd_read
 41505 00003F33 7303                            jnc	short menu_search
 41506 00003F35 E9EE01                          jmp	menu_abort
 41507                                  
 41508                                  ;   Search for MENU block; it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 41509                                  
 41510                                  menu_search:
 41511 00003F38 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 41512 00003F3A BF[C64C]                        mov     di,szMenu	;
 41513 00003F3D E80304                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 41514 00003F40 7337                            jnc	short menu_found ;
 41515 00003F42 C606[BE4C]00                    mov     byte [szBoot],0
 41516 00003F47 E90C02                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 41517                                  
 41518                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 41519                                  
 41520                                  menu_color:
 41521 00003F4A 51                      	push	cx              ;
 41522 00003F4B 52                      	push	dx              ;
 41523                                  	;;mov	dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 41524                                  	; 10/09/2023
 41525                                  	;mov	dl,7 ; !*!
 41526 00003F4C E89E06                  	call	get_number	; get first number
 41527 00003F4F 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh  ; !**!	; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 41528 00003F52 88DD                    	mov	ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 41529                                  	; 01/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization) by Erdogan Tan 
 41530                                  	; (high nibble of dl is 0)
 41531                                  	;and	dl,0F0h	; !*!	; (low nibble of dl would be zero)
 41532                                  	;or	dl,bl		; (low nibble of dl is 7) ! 14/08/2023
 41533 00003F54 88DA                    	mov	dl,bl	; 14/08/2023
 41534 00003F56 E83108                  	call	delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 41535 00003F59 750E                    	jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 41536 00003F5B E88F06                  	call	get_number	; get next number
 41537 00003F5E 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 41538 00003F61 88DE                    	mov	dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 41539                                  	; 10/09/2023
 41540                                  	;and	dl,0Fh	; !**!	;
 41541 00003F63 B104                    	mov	cl,4            ;
 41542 00003F65 D2E3                    	shl	bl,cl           ;
 41543 00003F67 08DA                    	or	dl,bl           ;
 41544                                  check_color:
 41545 00003F69 38F5                    	cmp	ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 41546 00003F6B 7503                    	jne	short set_color	; no
 41547 00003F6D 80F208                  	xor	dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 41548                                  set_color:
 41549 00003F70 8816[7C4C]              	mov	[bMenuColor],dl ;
 41550 00003F74 5A                      	pop	dx              ;
 41551 00003F75 59                      	pop	cx              ;
 41552 00003F76 E9A900                  	jmp	menu_nextitem
 41553                                  
 41554                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 41555                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 41556                                  
 41557                                  menu_found:
 41558 00003F79 C606[864C]01                    mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 41559                                          ;mov	word [offDefBlock],0
 41560 00003F7E C606[8A4C]FF                    mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 41561 00003F83 8026[854C]FD                    and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 41562                                  	; 10/09/2023
 41563 00003F88 29D2                    	sub	dx,dx
 41564 00003F8A 8916[884C]              	mov	[offDefBlock],dx ; 0
 41565                                  
 41566 00003F8E E85706                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 41567                                  	; 10/09/2023
 41568                                  	;sub	dx,dx		; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 41569                                  
 41570                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 41571                                  
 41572                                  menu_process:
 41573 00003F91 E87A06                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 41574 00003F94 722E                            jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 41575 00003F96 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 41576 00003F98 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 41577 00003F9A 7428                            je	short to_menu_getdefault
 41578 00003F9C 3C4F                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 41579 00003F9E 744D                            je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 41580 00003FA0 3C45                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 41581 00003FA2 7449                            je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 41582 00003FA4 3C41                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 41583 00003FA6 741E                            je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 41584 00003FA8 3C52                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 41585 00003FAA 749E                            je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 41586 00003FAC 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 41587 00003FAE 740F                            je	short menu_numlock ;
 41588 00003FB0 3C30                            cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 41589 00003FB2 746E                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 41590 00003FB4 E8C307                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 41591 00003FB7 7469                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 41592 00003FB9 F9                              stc                     ;
 41593 00003FBA E82607                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 41594 00003FBD EB63                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 41595                                  menu_numlock:
 41596 00003FBF E8EBFE                          call    set_numlock
 41597 00003FC2 EB5E                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 41598                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 41599 00003FC4 EB62                            jmp     short menu_getdefault
 41600                                  
 41601                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 41602                                  
 41603                                  menu_default:
 41604 00003FC6 8936[884C]                      mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 41605 00003FCA 803E[8B4C]00                    cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 41606 00003FCF 751A                            jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 41607 00003FD1 E8EA05                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 41608 00003FD4 724C                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 41609 00003FD6 E8FB05                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 41610 00003FD9 7247                            jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 41611 00003FDB 89DE                            mov     si,bx           ;
 41612 00003FDD E80D06                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 41613 00003FE0 80FB5A                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 41614                                  	;jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 41615 00003FE3 7602                            jna	short timeout_ok ; 01/08/2023
 41616 00003FE5 B35A                    	mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 41617                                  timeout_ok:                    ;
 41618 00003FE7 881E[8A4C]                      mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 41619                                  timeout_skip:
 41620 00003FEB EB35                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 41621                                  
 41622                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 41623                                  
 41624                                  menu_item:
 41625                                  	;cmp	dl,9	; 04/01/2023
 41626 00003FED 80FA09                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 41627 00003FF0 7330                            jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 41628 00003FF2 89F7                            mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 41629 00003FF4 E83303                          call    srch_block      ;
 41630 00003FF7 7406                            je	short menu_itemfound ;
 41631 00003FF9 F9                              stc                     ;
 41632 00003FFA E8E606                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 41633 00003FFD EB23                            jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 41634                                  
 41635                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 41636                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 41637                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 41638                                  
 41639                                  menu_itemfound:
 41640 00003FFF 42                              inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 41641 00004000 89D3                            mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 41642 00004002 8887[8C4C]                      mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 41643 00004006 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 41644                                  
 41645                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 41646                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 41647                                  ;   description...
 41648                                  
 41649 00004008 89B7[964C]                      mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 41650 0000400C 89B7[AA4C]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 41651 00004010 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 41652 00004012 E8A905                          call    skip_token      ;
 41653 00004015 720B                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 41654 00004017 E8BA05                          call    skip_delim      ;
 41655 0000401A 7206                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 41656 0000401C 87DF                            xchg    bx,di           ;
 41657 0000401E 89BF[AA4C]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 41658                                  
 41659                                  menu_nextitem:
 41660 00004022 E8C305                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 41661 00004025 E969FF                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 41662                                  
 41663                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 41664                                  
 41665                                  menu_getdefault:
 41666 00004028 08D2                            or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 41667 0000402A 7505                            jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 41668 0000402C 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 41669 0000402E E9ED00                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 41670                                  menu_valid:
 41671 00004031 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ;
 41672 00004033 8816[874C]                      mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 41673 00004037 8B3E[884C]                      mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 41674 0000403B 09FF                            or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 41675 0000403D 741C                            jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 41676 0000403F 43                              inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 41677                                  menu_chkdefault:
 41678 00004040 53                              push    bx              ;
 41679 00004041 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 41680 00004043 8BB7[964C]                      mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 41681 00004047 B98000                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 41682 0000404A 1E                              push    ds              ;
 41683 0000404B 06                              push    es              ;
 41684 0000404C 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 41685 0000404D E81A03                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 41686 00004050 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 41687 00004051 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 41688 00004052 7409                            je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 41689 00004054 43                              inc     bx              ;
 41690 00004055 3A1E[874C]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 41691 00004059 76E5                            jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 41692                                  menu_nodefault:
 41693 0000405B B301                            mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 41694                                  menu_setdefault:
 41695 0000405D 881E[864C]                      mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 41696                                  
 41697                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 41698                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 41699                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 41700                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 41701                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 41702                                  ;   with no timeout)
 41703                                  
 41704 00004061 803E[8A4C]00                    cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 41705 00004066 750A                            jne	short menu_display ; no
 41706 00004068 F606[854C]01                    test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 41707 0000406D 7503                            jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 41708 0000406F E9C700                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 41709                                  
 41710                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 41711                                  
 41712                                  menu_display:
 41713 00004072 B40F                            mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 41714 00004074 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41715 00004076 B400                            mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 41716 00004078 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41717 0000407A 06                              push    es              ;
 41718 0000407B B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 41719 0000407E 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 41720 00004080 26A14E00                        mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 41721 00004084 A3[834C]                        mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 41722 00004087 26A06200                        mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 41723 0000408B A2[824C]                        mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 41724 0000408E A1[7D4C]                        mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 41725 00004091 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41726 00004093 B80006                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 41727 00004096 8A3E[7C4C]                      mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 41728 0000409A 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 41729                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 41730 0000409C 268A164A00                      mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 41731 000040A1 FECA                    	dec     dl              ;
 41732                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 41733 000040A3 268A368400                      mov	dh,[es:84h]

 41764 000040EE 76F6                            jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet

 41787                                  menu_autoselect:
 41788 0000411E 83FBFF                          cmp     bx,-1 ; 0FFFFh	; clean boot requested?

 41814 00004152 8B9F[964C]                      mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 41815                                  
 41816                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 41817                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 41818                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
